steps: preheat oven to 400degf . separate each package of crescent roll dough into 8 triangles . cut each triangle into 3 smaller triangles . place 1 sausage on the wide end of triangle and roll towards the point . place wrapped sausage point side down on baking sheet . repeat with remaining sausages . bake 9 10 minutes until golden brown . serve with ketchup and mustard if desired.

name: roasted parsnips
description: sweet, peppery parsnips are an often overlooked root vegetable that, when roasted, deserve the side dish spotlight.
ner: parsnips, olive oil, salt, black pepper
ingredients: 1.0 pound parsnips, 1.0 tablespoon olive oil, 1.0 teaspoon salt, black pepper
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a sheet pan with parchment paper . slice the parsnips on the diagonal into 1/4 inch thick pieces . arrange the parsnips in an even layer on the baking sheet . drizzle the parsnips with olive oil . sprinkle with the salt and black pepper to taste . use a spatula to toss the parsnips until they are evenly coated . roast the parsnips on the middle rack of the oven, stirring once or twice during the cooking time, until they are fork tender and slightly caramelized, 40 50 minutes . check to see that parsnips are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . serve immediately.

name: thyme roasted pork tenderloin with balsamic shallot compote
description: recipe courtesy of michelle dudash
ner: canola oil, shallots, garlic, concord 100 grape juice, reduced sodium chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, honey, herbes de provence, salt, black pepper, salt, black pepper, dried thyme, canola oil, pork tenderloin, garlic powder
ingredients: 1.0 tablespoon canola oil, 2.8 cup shallots, 1.0 clove garlic, 0.5 cup concord 100 grape juice, 0.2 cup reduced sodium chicken broth, 2.0 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, 1.0 tablespoon honey, 0.2 teaspoon herbes de provence, 1.0 pinch salt, 1.0 pinch black pepper, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon black pepper, 0.2 teaspoon dried thyme, 2.0 teaspoon canola oil, 125.0 pound pork tenderloin, 0.2 teaspoon garlic powder
steps: preheat oven to 400degf . to make compote, heat large skillet on medium low heat . add 1 tbs oil to hot pan, followed by shallots . stir and gently cook for 5 minutes . do not brown . add 1 clove garlic and reduce heat as needed as vegetables shrink . cook 10 minutes . pour in grape juice, broth, vinegar, honey, and gently simmer 40 minutes or until liquid thickens and almost completely evaporates . stir in herbes de provence, 1 pinch salt, and 1 pinch 1 pinch pepper . to prepare pork, combine 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp pepper, and 1/4 tsp thyme and sprinkle on all sides of pork . heat large fry pan or skillet with oven proof handle on medium high heat and add 2 tsp oil . once oil shimmers, carefully add pork to pan, folding thinnest end of pork under itself and pressing down gently on center to ensure even browning . partially cover with lid or foil to speed cooking while allowing steam to escape . cook pork 3 to 4 minutes until brown on one side, then turn to brown 2 to 3 minutes on each remaining side until completely browned . larger tenderloins may need to be turned once more to brown completely . place in oven and cook 20 to 30 minutes, just until firm when pressed in the thickest section or an inserted thermometer reads 145degf . remove from oven, sprinkle evenly with garlic powder, and allow to rest 5 minutes . slice at an angle into 1/2 inch pieces and serve with compote . if tenderloin is smaller or larger than 1 1/4 pound, adjust amount of seasoning accordingly.

name: honey hot chops
description: honey hot chops with new york top loin pork chops, salt, black pepper, honey, hot pepper sauce
ner: new york top loin pork chops, salt, black pepper, honey, hot pepper sauce
ingredients: 4.0 new york top loin pork chops, salt, black pepper, 6.0 tablespoon honey, 2.0 tablespoon hot pepper sauce
steps: prepare medium hot fire in kettle style grill . in small bowl stir together honey and hot pepper sauce . season chops with salt and pepper and grill over direct heat, turning and basting with honey pepper sauce mixture, until chops are nicely browned, about 8 12 minutes until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees fahrenheit, followed by a 3 minute rest time.

name: smoked paprika chicken
description: how to make delicious smoked paprika chicken using boneless skinless chicken thighs or breasts . easy recipe using 5 simple ingredients . kosher, meat.
ner: boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, extra virgin olive oil,
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, 2 tbsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 3/4 tsp salt, 3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil,
steps: preheat the broiler on high . set a rack in the oven at least 6 inches below the flame . if you put the rack right under the flame, the chicken will burn on the outside before it's cooked through . in my oven, placing the rack on the second tier works best . yours may be different . brush a baking sheet evenly with olive oil about 1 tbsp to cover the sheet and lay the chicken thighs out flat . in a small bowl, stir together the smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt . sprinkle boths sides of all the thighs generously with the seasoning, completely covering the surface of the chicken . broil the chicken for about 7 minutes on each side, until the thighs are cooked through and have developed a nice crust . a little blackening on the edges is ok and will give it a "grilled" flavor . broilers tend to vary in terms of strength if your chicken seems to be burning or cooking too fast, move the rack down a notch and continue broiling until fully cooked . once the chicken has cooked through internal temperature of 160 degrees f, serve immediately.

name: hot and spicy buffalo shrimp dip
description: move over buffalo wings, this hot and cheesy shrimp dip will have everyone going back for more this buffalo dip is perfect for super or any party appetizer.
ner: cooking spray, reduced fat cream cheese, reduced fat sour cream, franks hot sauce, white wine vinegar, 12.5 oz cooked peeled large shrimp, diced, reduced fat sargento mexican blend
ingredients: cooking spray, 4 oz reduced fat cream cheese, 1/2 cup reduced fat sour cream, 1/2 cup franks hot sauce, 1 tsp white wine vinegar, 2 cups 12.5 oz cooked peeled large shrimp, diced, 3/4 cup reduced fat sargento mexican blend
steps: preheat oven to 375deg . lightly spray an 8 x 8 or 9 x 9 baking dish, or even a pie dish with cooking spray . combine the first 4 ingredients together and 1/4 cup of the cheese mix until smooth . add the shrimp mix well and put in a small oven safe dish . bake in the oven until hot, about 20 25 minutes . remove from oven and top with remaining cheese, bake until melted, about 4 5 minutes.

name: best barbecue ribs ever katie lee
description: food network magazine
ner: brown sugar, chili powder, ground black pepper, dried oregano, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, baby back ribs, low sodium chicken broth, apple cider vinegar, barbecue sauce
ingredients: 0.2 cup brown sugar, 2.0 tablespoon chili powder, ground black pepper, 1.0 teaspoon dried oregano, 0.5 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 0.5 teaspoon onion powder, 2.0 baby back ribs, 1.0 cup low sodium chicken broth, 2.0 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, 1.0 cup barbecue sauce
steps: combine the brown sugar, chili powder, 1 tablespoon salt, 1 teaspoon black pepper, the oregano, cayenne, garlic powder and onion powder in a small bowl and rub the mixture on both sides of the ribs . cover and refrigerate 1 hour or overnight . preheat the oven to 250 degrees f . in a roasting pan, combine the broth and vinegar . add the ribs to the pan . cover with foil and tightly seal . bake 2 hours . remove the ribs from the pan and place them on a platter . pour the liquid from the pan into a saucepan and bring to a boil . lower the heat to a simmer and cook until reduced by half . add the barbecue sauce . preheat an outdoor grill to medium high . put the ribs on the grill and cook about 5 minutes on each side, until browned and slightly charred . cut the ribs between the bones and toss them in a large bowl with the sauce . serve hot.

name: smoked turkey and raspberry salad
description: smoked turkey and raspberry salad with hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, preserves, lemon juice, sesame seeds, mixed salad greens, turkey, frozen raspberries in heavy syrup, partially thawed
ner: hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, preserves, lemon juice, sesame seeds, mixed salad greens, turkey, frozen raspberries in heavy syrup, partially thawed
ingredients: 0.8 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 0.2 cup preserves, 2.0 tablespoon lemon juice, 1.0 tablespoon sesame seeds, 4.0 cup mixed salad greens, 0.5 pound turkey, frozen raspberries in heavy syrup, partially thawed
steps: 1. in small bowl combine hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, raspberry preserves, lemon juice and poppy seeds cover and chill to blend flavors . 2. on chilled salad plates, layer greens, then turkey . 3. spoon dressing over salads . garnish, if desired, with raspberries.

name: superfood triple berry chia pudding
description: i love chia pudding and what can be easier than throwing a few chia seeds into a mason jar with fresh fruit berries and almond milk and giving it a good shake
ner: unsweetened almond/coconut milk beverage, fresh blueberries, chia seeds, drops nu naturals liquid stevia
ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond/coconut milk beverage, 3/4 cup fresh blueberries, 2 tbsp chia seeds, 5 6 drops nu naturals liquid stevia
steps: combine the almond breeze almond coconut milk together with the chia seeds and fruit in a glass jar with a lid . cover and shake well, set aside for 15 minutes . give it another good shake then refrigerate overnight or at least 5 6 hours . divide into 2 bowls or glass serving dishes and serve . enjoy

name: grilled breakfast pizzas with pesto
description: grilled breakfast pizzas with pesto with fresh basil, arugula, garlic, pine nuts, extra virgin olive oil, grated parmesan cheese, kosher salt, flour, sugar, active dry yeast, kosher salt, warm water, extra virgin olive oil, extra virgin olive oil, grated mozzarella cheese, bacon strips, eggs, salt, pepper, fresh parsley
ner: fresh basil, arugula, garlic, pine nuts, extra virgin olive oil, grated parmesan cheese, kosher salt, flour, sugar, active dry yeast, kosher salt, warm water, extra virgin olive oil, extra virgin olive oil, grated mozzarella cheese, bacon strips, eggs, salt, pepper, fresh parsley
ingredients: 6.0 cup fresh basil, 2.0 cup arugula, 4.0 clove garlic, 0.5 cup pine nuts, 0.5 cup extra virgin olive oil, 0.8 cup grated parmesan cheese, kosher salt, 4.0 cup flour, 1.0 teaspoon sugar, 1.0 package active dry yeast, 1.0 teaspoon kosher salt, 1.5 cup warm water, 1.0 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, extra virgin olive oil, 4.0 cup grated mozzarella cheese, 16.0 bacon strips, 12.0 eggs, salt, pepper, fresh parsley
steps: using your kitchenaid stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine the flour, sugar, yeast and salt, on a low setting to mix up the dry ingredients . while the stand mixer is running, pour in the warm water and the olive oil and continue to mix on a medium speed setting until the dough starts to form into a ball, around the dough hook . check your dough if it looks too wet, add a little more flour as needed . if it looks too dry, add a tablespoon of water and mix again . remove from the stand mixer and place onto a lightly floured work surface . knead the dough for a minute or so and shape into a ball . place the dough ball into a large sized greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap and place a kitchen towel over the bowl . let sit for about an hour, or until the dough has doubled in size . turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface again and divide it into four pieces . shape into small dough balls, place on a large plate, cover with a slightly damp kitchen towel and let sit for about 10 minutes . then, working on a lightly floured work surface, take one dough ball and, using either a rolling pin or your hands, spread the dough out gently into the shape of a square or something close to it . you can also shape pizzas into round circles if desired . repeat with remaining dough balls as needed . and now, for the best part the grilling turn on your kitchenaid grill to about 400 to 425 degrees and let the grill heat up . make sure you have all of the ingredients for your pizza, the pesto included, right next to your grill . once the pizza dough goes on and is ready, you need to work fast to ensure your pizza crust does not burn . brush each side of the pizza dough lightly with extra virgin olive oil and place onto a large baking sheet covered with parchment paper or a non stick baking mat . once the grill is ready, place the pizza dough on the hottest part of the grill, and close the lid . check the pizza crust after a minute or so . once grill marks have appeared and the crust is slightly crispy, flip it using tongs and a large grill spatula . close the lid and check the crust after a minute or so . after the pizza crust is grilled just slightly, remove the pizza crust from the grill and close the grill so the grill stays hot . brush on some pesto over one side of the pizza crust and place back into the hot grill, but in a spot that does not have direct heat . while on the grill, sprinkle on some of the mozzarella cheese i used about 1 cup for each pizza, and close the grill . check the pizza after a minute to ensure it is not burning and you have placed the pizza in a good spot . turn the grill heat down a little if you need to . close the lid again . after about 1 to 2 minutes, when the cheese has melted slightly, arrange 4 slices of the cooked bacon slices on top, around the outer edge of the pizza crust . you want to do this so the cooked bacon slices hold the eggs in place and keep them from slipping off . carefully crack two eggs or 3 if desired directly on top of the pizza, close the grill and let cook for about 5 to 6 minutes, or until the eggs have set . when ready, remove the pizza from the grill, season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh parsley . serve pizzas with grilled bell peppers and grilled sausage . combine the basil, arugula, garlic, and pine nuts in your kitchenaid food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped . with the food processor running, slowly pour the olive oil into the bowl through the feed tube and process until the pesto is thoroughly combined . add the parmesan cheese and pulse again until smooth . season with salt and pulse one last time . remove from the food processor and set aside . using your kitchenaid stand mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine the flour, sugar, yeast and salt, on a low setting to mix up the dry ingredients . while the stand mixer is running, pour in the warm water and the olive oil and continue to mix on a medium speed setting until the dough starts to form into a ball, around the dough hook . check your dough if it looks too wet, add a little more flour as needed . if it looks too dry, add a tablespoon of water and mix again . remove from the stand mixer and onto a lightly floured work surface . knead the dough for a minute or so and shape into a ball . place the dough ball into a large sized greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap and place a kitchen towel over the bowl . let sit for about an hour, or until the dough has doubled in size . turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface again and divide it into four pieces . shape into small dough balls, place on a large plate, cover with a slightly damp kitchen towel and let sit for about 10 minutes . working on a lightly floured work surface, take one dough ball and, using either a rolling pin or your hands, spread the dough out gently into the shape of a square, or something close to it . you can also shape pizzas into round circles if desired . repeat with remaining dough balls as needed . for the breakfast pizza turn on your kitchenaid grill to about 400 to 425 degrees and let the grill heat up . make sure you have all of the ingredients, the pesto included, you will need for your pizza, right next to your grill . once the pizza dough goes on and is ready, you need to work fast to ensure your pizza crust does not burn . brush each side of the pizza dough lightly with extra virgin olive oil and place onto a large baking sheet covered with parchment paper or a non stick baking mat . once the grill is ready, place the pizza dough on the hottest part of the grill and close the lid . check the pizza crust after a minute or so . once grill marks have appeared and the crust is slightly crispy, flip it using tongs and a large grill spatula . close the lid and check the crust after a minute or so . after the pizza crust is grilled just slightly, remove the pizza crust from the grill and close the grill so the grill stays hot . brush on some pesto over one side of the pizza crust and place back into the hot grill but in a spot that does not have direct heat . while on the grill, sprinkle on some of the mozzarella cheese i used about 1 cup for each pizza, and close the grill . check the pizza after a minute to ensure it is not burning and you have placed the pizza in a good spot . turn the grill heat down a little if you need to . close the lid again . after about 1 to 2 minutes, when the cheese has melted slightly, arrange 4 slices of the cooked bacon slices on top, around the outer edge of the pizza crust . you want to do this so the cooked bacon slices hold the eggs in place and keep them from slipping off . carefully crack two eggs or 3 if desired directly on top of the pizza and close the grill and let cook for about 5 to 6 minutes, or until the eggs have set . when ready, remove the pizza from the grill, season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh parsley . serve pizzas with grilled bell peppers and grilled sausage.

name: cauliflower fritters
description: this is a delicious way to prepare cauliflower . it's similar to the taste of a potato pancake and makes a fabulous side dish your kids will love them
ner: roughly chopped raw cauliflower, garlic, white whole wheat flour, extra large eggs, plus 2 tbsp grated pecorino romano, parsley, hot water, kosher salt and pepper, olive oil
ingredients: 6 cups roughly chopped raw cauliflower, 3 cloves garlic, 1 cup white whole wheat flour, 2 extra large eggs, 1/2 cup plus 2 tbsp grated pecorino romano, 1/4 cup parsley, 1/3 cup hot water, 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper, 4 teaspoons olive oil
steps: steam the cauliflower in 2 1/2 cups water over medium heat until tender, about 5 to 6 minutes . drain and quickly rinse under cold water to stop it from cooking . chop the cauliflower into smaller pieces with a knife once steamed and measure to make 5 cups . set aside the rest for another use . in a large bowl, combine the steamed cauliflower, flour, garlic, eggs, grated cheese, parsley, 3/4 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper . add water so that batter becomes slightly more dense than pancake batter . heat a 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium low heat, add 1 teaspoon of oil coating bottom of the pan . use a 1/4 cup measuring cup to form fritters . you can fit 4 fritters at a time, flattening them slightly with the back of the measuring cup . cook until golden brown, about 2 1/2 to 3 minutes on each side . repeat with the remaining oil and batter 3 more times.

name: shrimp quesadillas with tomato avocado salsa
description: shrimp, avocados and melted cheese, what a combination
ner: large shrimp, cumin, garlic powder, salt and fresh pepper, cooking spray, scallions, cabot's 75 light vermont cheddar, 6" low carb whole wheat flour tortillas i used la tortilla factory, medium tomato, hass avocado, lime, cilantro, red onion
ingredients: 16 large shrimp, cumin, garlic powder, salt and fresh pepper, cooking spray, 4 scallions, 6 oz cabot's 75 light vermont cheddar, 8 6" low carb whole wheat flour tortillas i used la tortilla factory, 1 medium tomato, 1 hass avocado, 1 lime, 1 tbsp cilantro, 1 tbsp red onion
steps: in a medium bowl, combine tomatoes, avocado, red onion, lime juice, cilantro, salt and pepper . season shrimp with salt, pepper, cumin, and garlic powder . lightly spray a hot skillet on medium heat with cooking spray, add shrimp and scallions . cook 2 3 minutes on each side until shrimp is cooked though . remove from heat and cut shrimp in half lengthwise, set aside . heat skillet on medium heat and lightly spray with oil . add tortilla, top with 1.5 oz cheese, 8 shrimp halves, and tomato avocado salsa . when the cheese is melted and the bottom of the tortilla is golden brown, place the other tortilla on top . put a plate on top of the quesadilla to flip it over onto the plate . then slide the other side onto the skillet . cook another minute and remove with a spatula . cut into wedges and serve immediately.

name: italian chicken sandwiches
description: italian chicken sandwiches with boneless chicken cutlet, zucchini, wish bone, hellmann' or best food real mayonnais, italian bread
ner: boneless chicken cutlet, zucchini, wish bone, hellmann' or best food real mayonnais, italian bread
ingredients: 4.0 boneless chicken cutlet, 1.0 zucchini, 0.2 cup wish bone, 0.3 cup hellmann' or best food real mayonnais, 1.0 loaf italian bread
steps: grill or broil chicken and zucchini, brushing frequently with wish bone italian dressing, until chicken is thoroughly cooked . meanwhile, spread hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise on both sides of bread . arrange chicken and zucchini on bread . wrap in aluminum foil and keep warm . to serve, cut into 4 pieces.

name: classic beef and bean chili
description: when you're wanting a crowd pleasing chili, look no further . this one comes together quickly, and it's made with all the classic spices plus two kinds of beans, and jalapeno chilies . the chili is great the day it's made, but even better after a day or two in the fridge . at serving time, set out a mini topping bar for diners to customize their bowls . the recipe is a yummly original created by katie workman.
ner: onion, large carrot, celery stalks, ground beef, extra virgin olive oil, crushed tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder, ground cumin, bay leaf, salt, pepper, kidney beans, jarred jalapeno chilies, chicken broth, tomatoes, onion, cilantro sprigs, sour cream, shredded mexican cheese blend
ingredients: 1.0 onion, 1.0 large carrot, 2.0 celery stalks, 1.0 pound ground beef, 1.0 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1.0 can crushed tomatoes, 1.0 tablespoon chili powder, 1.0 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.0 teaspoon ground cumin, 1.0 bay leaf, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon pepper, 1.0 can kidney beans, 0.2 cup jarred jalapeno chilies, 1.0 cup chicken broth, 1.0 cup tomatoes, 0.5 cup onion, 0.5 cup cilantro sprigs, 0.5 cup sour cream, 1.0 cup shredded mexican cheese blend
steps: chop onion, carrot, and celery set them aside . brown meat in a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat, stirring frequently to break it up into crumbles, until no pink remains, about 5 minutes . turn meat into a colander set over a plate to drain excess fat . return pot to medium heat and add oil . when oil is hot, add onions, carrots, and celery cook, stirring often, until vegetables start to soften, about 10 minutes . add browned beef, tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, bay leaf, salt, and pepper to chili . add beans, and stir in jalapenos . bring chili to a simmer and stir in chicken broth if needed for a thick but still soupy texture . cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until flavors are blended, about 20 minutes . dice tomatoes and onion, and put each in a small bowl . put cilantro, sour cream, and cheese in additional small bowls the five bowls form the mini topping bar . ladle chili into serving bowls, and add whatever toppings you like . any leftovers can be refrigerated up to 4 days or frozen up to 3 months . pro tip this chili can also be frozen in airtight containers . defrost it in the refrigerator . to reheat, warm the chili in a large pot over medium heat, stirring frequently until hot.

name: noodle and vegetable skillet dinner
description: noodle and vegetable skillet dinner with knorr pasta sides chicken, water, i can't believe it's not butter spread, zucchini, onion, tomato, pitted ripe olives, grated parmesan cheese
ner: knorr pasta sides chicken, water, i can't believe it's not butter spread, zucchini, onion, tomato, pitted ripe olives, grated parmesan cheese
ingredients: 1.0 package knorr pasta sides chicken, 2.0 cup water, 2.0 tablespoon i can't believe it's not butter spread, 1.0 zucchini, 1.0 onion, 1.0 tomato, 0.5 cup pitted ripe olives, 2.0 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese
steps: prepare knorr pasta sides chicken with water and 1 tablespoon spread according to package directions . meanwhile, melt remaining 1 tablespoon spread in 12 inch skillet over medium high heat and cook zucchini and onion, stirring occasionally, until crisp tender, about 4 minutes . add tomato and cook, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes . toss with hot pasta sides, olives and cheese.

name: skillet taco cauliflower rice
description: skillet taco cauliflower rice, an easy skillet dinner made with ground turkey and cauliflower rice topped with lettuce, avocado and salsa for an low carb, weeknight meal
ner: 93 lean ground turkey, kosher salt, garlic powder, cumin, chili powder, paprika, dried oregano, small onion, bell pepper, water, canned tomato sauce, uncooked riced cauliflower, for the toppings, avocado, chopped cilantro, chopped lettuce, jarred salsa, lime wedges
ingredients: 1 lb 93 lean ground turkey, 1 1/4 tsp kosher salt, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp dried oregano, 1/2 small onion, 2 tbsp bell pepper, 3/4 cup water, 4 oz canned tomato sauce, 4 cups uncooked riced cauliflower, for the toppings, 4 ounces avocado, chopped cilantro, 1 cup chopped lettuce, 1/4 cup jarred salsa, lime wedges
steps: over high heat, brown the turkey in a large skillet breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks, about 5 minutes . when no longer pink add 1 teaspoon salt and the dry seasoning and mix well . add the onion, pepper, water and tomato sauce and cover . simmer on low for about 15 minutes . remove the cover and add the cauliflower, add 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook until tender, about 8 minutes . transfer to a plate and serve with avocado, lettuce, salsa and lime.

name: israeli shakshuka with zhug
description: israeli shakshuka with zhug with pita bread, jalapenos, salt, garlic cloves, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, cilantro leaves, fresh parsley leaves, lemon juice, virgin olive oil, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, anaheim chile, garlic cloves, smoked paprika, ground cumin, tomatoes, water, sugar, fresh parsley leaves, eggs
ner: pita bread, jalapenos, salt, garlic cloves, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, cilantro leaves, fresh parsley leaves, lemon juice, virgin olive oil, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, anaheim chile, garlic cloves, smoked paprika, ground cumin, tomatoes, water, sugar, fresh parsley leaves, eggs
ingredients: 6.0 pita bread, 4.0 jalapenos, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 2.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 teaspoon cumin seeds, 0.5 teaspoon coriander seeds, 2.0 cardamom pods, 1.0 bunch cilantro leaves, 1.0 bunch fresh parsley leaves, 2.0 tablespoon lemon juice, 2.0 tablespoon virgin olive oil, 2.0 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 1.0 red onion, 1.0 anaheim chile, 4.0 garlic cloves, 2.0 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1.0 teaspoon ground cumin, 28.0 ounce tomatoes, 0.8 cup water, 1.0 pinch sugar, 1.0 handful fresh parsley leaves, 12.0 eggs
steps: combine all the ingredients for the zhug in the container of the kitchenaid 5 speed hand blender and pulse until all the leaves and chiles are broken up, but the mixture is still a bit chunky like a pureed salsa . taste and add more salt and pepper, as desired . zhug can be made up to 4 days ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container until ready to use . preheat the kitchenaid compact oven to 350deg f and arrange a rack in the middle . heat oil in a large skillet from the kitchenaid tri ply stainless steel 10 piece set over medium heat . when it simmers, add onions, garlic, and chile . season with a pinch of salt and some ground pepper, and cook until onions are softened, about 5 minutes . stir in the cumin and paprika and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds . add tomatoes and bring to a simmer . reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until flavors are melded, about 10 to 15 minutes . taste and add more salt and sugar as desired . the sauce should be the consistency of tomato sauce . if it gets too thick, add some of the water to thin it out . sauce can be made up to 4 days ahead and refrigerated in an airtight container until ready to use . divide the mixture into small baking dishes for individual servings . i like to make enough sauce for 6 to 8 servings and then just assemble and bake off the mixture in individual servings . stir in half of the parsley and create little wells in the sauce for each egg . break one egg into each well . place the baking dishes into the compact oven and bake for about 15 to 20 minutes, until the eggs are set . season with freshly ground black pepper and serve immediately with pita bread and zhug sauce.

name: toasted ham and cheese tortas
description: toasted ham and cheese tortas with cooked ham, shredded monterey jack cheese, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, hoagies or rolls, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, avocado, red onion
ner: cooked ham, shredded monterey jack cheese, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, hoagies or rolls, chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, avocado, red onion
ingredients: 0.8 pound cooked ham, 1.0 cup shredded monterey jack cheese, 0.2 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 4.0 hoagies or rolls, 1.0 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, 1.0 avocado, 0.5 cup red onion
steps: combine hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise with chipotle pepper in small bowl . evenly spread mayonnaise mixture in rolls, then evenly layer remaining ingredients . wrap sandwiches in aluminum foil and bake 12 minutes or until cheese is melted . preheat oven to 350deg.

name: pumpkin french toast casserole
description: like eating pumpkin pie for breakfast, this casserole is the perfect addition to your fall brunch table . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ner: nonstick cooking spray, day old challah, eggs, light brown sugar, pumpkin puree, whole milk, vanilla extract, cinnamon, ground ginger, ground nutmeg, allspice, ground cloves, salt, powdered sugar, maple syrup
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 1.0 pound day old challah, 8.0 eggs, 0.7 cup light brown sugar, 0.8 cup pumpkin puree, 1.5 cup whole milk, 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1.5 teaspoon cinnamon, 0.8 teaspoon ground ginger, 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 0.2 teaspoon allspice, 0.2 teaspoon ground cloves, 0.1 teaspoon salt, powdered sugar, maple syrup
steps: preheat oven to 350degf . spray a 9x13 inch baking dish liberally with nonstick cooking spray . cut bread into 1 inch cubes and transfer to a large mixing bowl . set aside . in a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, brown sugar, pumpkin puree, milk, vanilla extract, spices, and salt and whisk until smooth . add to bread cubes, and fold with a rubber spatula . transfer bread mixture to prepared baking dish . bake french toast on the middle rack of oven until it is golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted in the center of a piece comes out clean, 45 50 minutes . check to see that french toast is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow french toast to cool in dish for at least 10 minutes . prior to serving, plate toast cut as desired, sift powdered sugar over the top, and drizzle with maple syrup . refrigerate leftovers for 2 3 days.

name: economy casserole
description: family favourite recipe from my mother in law
ner: none, none, none, none, none, none, none, none, none, none
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: simmer frankfurts in water for 3 mins and drain . set aside in casserole dish . melt butter in saucepan, add onion, potato, carrots and celery . cover and cook over low heat stiring frequently until vegetables have softened . add flour and cook for a few mins . add milk and bring to boil . add salt and pepper . pour into casserole dish and cover with cheese . cook until cheese is melted at 180 degrees.

name: one pot lo mein
description: one pot lo mein with cooked chicken, pasta, medium carrots, red bell pepper, green onions, garlic, soy sauce, garlic powder, corn starch, sugar, red pepper flakes, chicken broth, extra virgin olive oil
ner: cooked chicken, pasta, medium carrots, red bell pepper, green onions, garlic, soy sauce, garlic powder, corn starch, sugar, red pepper flakes, chicken broth, extra virgin olive oil
ingredients: 2.0 cup cooked chicken, 1.0 pound pasta, 4.0 medium carrots, 1.0 red bell pepper, 1.0 bunch green onions, 4.0 clove garlic, 0.2 cup soy sauce, 1.0 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.0 teaspoon corn starch, 1.0 tablespoon sugar, 0.5 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 4.0 cup chicken broth, 2.0 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil
steps: add the chicken, then the pasta, then the remaining ingredients to a large stockpot and cover . bring to a rolling boil over high heat . stir and reduce the heat to medium low . cook covered for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally . cook until most of the liquid is gone and the chicken is cooked through . remove the lid and let the dish rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: miser wot ethiopian lentil stew
description: miser wot is a traditional ethiopian lentil stew . it is a delicious and spicy vegan stew that is traditionally eaten with ingera ethiopian bread but also goes well with rice or pita bread.
ner: finely chopped onions, minced garlic, minced ginger, red lentil, berbere, hot water, oil, salt
ingredients: 2.0 finely chopped onions, 2.0 clove minced garlic, 2.0 teaspoon minced ginger, 1.0 cup red lentil, 1.0 tablespoon berbere, 2.0 cup hot water, oil, salt
steps: add onions to a large pot over medium heat add oil and stir until the onion are translucent stir in the garlic and ginger add the berbere add a few drops of water to mix evenly, stir in a separate pot boil some water i use a teapot rinse the starch off the lentil until the water is clear you can do this in advance then add to the pot . stir . add water and turn heat to low let cook for 10 15 minutes or until the lentils are cooked . tip make sure you do not leave on stove too long as the lentils will overcook and lose their form . add salt and serve

name: masa polenta with sausage and peppers
description: masa polenta with sausage and peppers with chorizo sausage, vegetable oil, green bell pepper, sliced, sweet onion, garlic, water, knorr chicken flavor bouillon, masa harina, chopped fresh cilantro, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise
ner: chorizo sausage, vegetable oil, green bell pepper, sliced, sweet onion, garlic, water, knorr chicken flavor bouillon, masa harina, chopped fresh cilantro, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise
ingredients: 8.0 ounce chorizo sausage, 3.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 3.0 green bell pepper, sliced, 1.0 sweet onion, 2.0 clove garlic, 2.5 cup water, 1.0 tablespoon knorr chicken flavor bouillon, 0.5 cup masa harina, 2.0 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, 0.2 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise
steps: cook chorizo in 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium high heat, stirring frequently, until browned, about 4 minutes . remove from skillet and set aside . heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat and cook garlic, stirring occasionally, 1 minute . stir in water and knorr chicken flavor bouillon . bring to a boil over high heat . gradually whisk in masa . boil until thickened, about 2 minutes . remove from heat and whisk in hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise . stir in cilantro . transfer polenta to serving platter, then top with sausage and peppers . garnish, if desired, with crumbled queso fresco . heat 2 tablespoons oil in same skillet over medium high heat and cook green peppers and onion, stirring occasionally, until very soft, about 8 minutes . remove from skillet and keep warm.

name: pork roast tangerine
description: savory roast with a tangerine glaze . serve with alfredo noodles and buttered broccoli.
ner: pork loin roast, dry mustard, salt, pepper, tangerine, water, tangerine juice, honey, cornstarch, butter
ingredients: 3.0 pound pork loin roast, 1.0 tablespoon dry mustard, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon pepper, 1.0 tangerine, 1.0 cup water, 1.0 cup tangerine juice, 0.2 cup honey, 1.0 tablespoon cornstarch, 2.0 tablespoon butter
steps: in a small bowl combine mustard, salt and pepper . rub roast with mustard mixture . place roast on rack in shallow roasting pan . roast pork in a 350 degree f . oven for 1 hour 20 minutes per pound or until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees f . remove roast from oven let rest about 10 minutes . meanwhile, rinse tangerine or orange and remove peel, reserving peel . section tangerine or orange and set aside . remove white membrane from peel and cut about 2 tablespoons julienne strips . in small saucepan combine julienne strips and 1 cup water . bring to boiling reduce heat and simmer about 15 minutes . drain . in small saucepan combine tangerine or orange juice and honey . in small bowl combine cornstarch and 1 tablespoon water . add to tangerine juice honey mixture . cook over medium heat till thickened and bubbly, stirring constantly . add butter and cooked peel cook till butter melts, stirring constantly . slice roast and arrange on serving platter . garnish with tangerine or orange sections and spoon sauce over.

name: michaels fantasy
description: our owen creation
ner: vodka, baileys, bols, cream
ingredients: 20.0 milliliter vodka, 20.0 milliliter baileys, 20.0 milliliter bols, 100.0 milliliter cream
steps: add all the ingredients in a shaker with 10 ice cubs shake and serve in a glass pouco grand, sprinkle nutmeg on the top

name: spatzligratin mit ruebli und speck
description: ein einfaches, schnelles und sehr feines gratin . wer uber die notige zeit und das fingerspitzengefuhl verfugt macht die spatzli selber . dazu braucht es nebst einem spatzlibrett, einem spatzlisieb oder dem spatzler 200 g mehl, 100 g knopflimehl, 1 knapper teeloffel salz, 150 ml milch . alles in eine schussel mischen, 3 frische eier dazu geben und den teig gut mischen . bei raumtemperatur eine halbe stunden stehen lassen . danach den teig portionenweise mit dem spatzligerat seiner wahl direkt ins leicht siedende salzwasser geben . sobald eine portion verarbeitet ist und die spatzli an die oberflache steigen, mit einer schaumkelle herausnehmen und abtropfen lassen . wer keine lust auf's "spatzlen" hat, kauft sich fertige frische spatzli.
ner: none, none, none, none, none, none, none, none, none
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: 200 g ruebli waschen, schalen und mit der rostiraffel raffeln . 2 schalotten rusten und fein hacken . 100 g emmentaler kase fein reiben . die fein gehakte schalotte in einer pfanne mit einem essloffel bratbutter andunsten . die ruebli und die speckwurfeli dazugeben und einige minuten mit dunsten . mit salz und pfeffer wurzen und abschmecken . in eine gratinform eine lage spatzli geben . die speck ruebli schalotten mischung daruber geben und die halfte des emmentaler kases daruber streuen . den restlichen spatzli daruber geben und die andere halfte das emmentaler kases daruber streuen . 200 ml halbrahm daruber giessen und nochmals mit salz und pfeffer wurzen . das gratin fur 15 20 minuten bei 200degc im backofen gratinieren . zum anrichten mit etwas frischen krautern garnieren.

name: israeli fish pot with spicy tomato sauce
description: i will share the recipe of my husband's mother born in algeria, which is a great cook . it is one of the recipes she taught me before .... about 30 years ago when i met her son who later became my husband.
ner: fish fillets, extra virgin olive oil, garlic, green pepper, sweet red pepper, tomato paste, turmeric, cumin, salt, black pepper, fresh coriander
ingredients: 1.0 kilogram fish fillets, 2.0 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, 4.0 clove garlic, green pepper, sweet red pepper, 2.0 tablespoon tomato paste, 1.0 teaspoon turmeric, 0.5 teaspoon cumin, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 1.0 teaspoon black pepper, 0.5 bunch fresh coriander
steps: in a large saucepan heat the olive oil, add the onion and cook over medium heat about 4 minutes while stirring . dd the garlic and hot pepper, sweeadd the tomato paste and cook for about 5 minutes along add the spices and cook together for another 5 minutes . preferably lower the heat to a low heat.t and fry for another 4 minutes . add about 2 cups of water and "open up" the sauce . increase heat and bring the sauce to a gentle boil . after several minutes of boiling, add the fish is cut into pieces as of about 7 cm each . arrange the pieces around saucepan, in a single layer . cook for about 10 minutes when the pot covered . add the chopped coriander over and cook for another 5 minutes.

name: dark chocolate fruit candies with pomegranates, figs and dates
description: recipe for simple all natural dark chocolate fruit candies with pomegranates, figs and dates featuring 3 of the 7 species . gluten free, dairy free.
ner: dark chocolate, pomegranate seeds, dates, chopped into small pieces, dried figs, chopped into small pieces
ingredients: 4 bars dark chocolate, 2/3 cup pomegranate seeds, 2/3 cup dates, chopped into small pieces, 2/3 cup dried figs, chopped into small pieces
steps: line a mini muffin pan with paper muffin cups . break the dark chocolate bars into smaller pieces and slowly melt over a double boiler . if you don't have a double boiler, you can melt the chocolate in a glass, pyrex or metal bowl set securely atop a pan of simmering water . note to avoid blooming the filmy layer that sometimes rises to the surface of chocolate after it sets it doesn't affect flavor but it's not very pretty, you can temper the chocolate . you'll need a thermometer . david lebovitz has terrific detailed instructions here . once the chocolate is melted, spoon a little into each cup so that the bottom is completely covered . spoon about 2 teaspoons of the pomegranate seeds into 12 of the chocolate cups, dividing the fruit evenly between the cups . repeat with the chopped dates and figs 12 of each until all of the cups have been filled . cover the fruit candies with the remaining melted chocolate . don't be afraid to get a little messy here . embrace the imperfection . they don't need to look neat and tidy . leave the chocolates in a cool, dry place for about 4 hours until set . you can speed up the process by placing them in the fridge for about 30 minutes . over time the chocolate may "bloom" a process in which the sugar or fat rises to surface of the chocolate and creates a cloudy or spotty appearance . they'll still taste great, they just won't be as pretty . as i mentioned above, you can temper the chocolate to avoid blooming . keep the pomegranate dark chocolates in the fridge for up to a week . the others can stay at room temperature in a cool, dry place for 2 3 weeks.

name: chocolate cake and its icing
description: chocolate cake is the perfect way to show someone you care . they are perfect for holidays, birthdays, parties and special events . this chocolate cake combines dark chocolate chunks or chips with cocoa powder to create a flavorful decadence that will melt in your mouth . be sure to add these ingredients to your next shopping trip so you can make sure to surprise your loved ones with a rich and creamy sweet treat they will love.
ner: butter, vanilla extract, granulated sugar, eggs, all purpose flour, baking powder, unsweetened cocoa powder, water, dark chocolate, powdered sugar, hot water
ingredients: 155.0 gram butter, 1.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 275.0 gram granulated sugar, 2.0 eggs, 200.0 gram all purpose flour, 1.0 teaspoon baking powder, 50.0 gram unsweetened cocoa powder, 160.0 milliliter water, 90.0 gram dark chocolate, 160.0 gram powdered sugar, 2.0 tablespoon hot water
steps: preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit . in a bowl, beat 125 grams of softened butter, vanilla extract, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder and sifted cocoa powder as well as the water, at slow speed . increase to higher speed and beat the mixture for about 3 minutes . the batter should become smooth . pour the mixture into your round cake pan 20 cm . diameter and bake the cake for 1 hour . let it cool before removing from the pan . in the meantime prepare the chocolate icing . melt the chocolate and 30 grams of diced butter in a double boiler . gradually add the powdered sugar and the hot water and stir . pour the icing over the cake.

name: mini ground beef and mashed potato pies
description: these mini ground beef and potato pies make for a hearty and warming meal that is perfect for lunch or dinner . this recipe makes two mini pies, meaning it is great for couples or simply save the second pie to enjoy tomorrow . if you have leftover mashed potatoes you want to use, you can easily use them in this recipe in place of making fresh ones, perfect for saving time.
ner: potato, salt, ground black pepper, milk, cheese, ground nutmeg, cheddar cheese, garlic clove, onion, ground beef, tomato sauce, dried oregano
ingredients: 1.0 potato, salt, ground black pepper, milk, 2.0 cheese, ground nutmeg, cheddar cheese, 1.0 garlic clove, 0.5 onion, 200.0 gram ground beef, 2.0 tablespoon tomato sauce, dried oregano
steps: add the potato to a pot of boiling salted water . cook for about 10 minutes . drain the potato pieces and place in a bowl . season the potato with a sprinkle of salt and black pepper to taste . add a splash of milk, the laughing cow cheese, and a pinch of nutmeg . mash with a fork . add a small amount of cheddar cheese and mix well . set aside . add a tablespoon of oil in a skillet on medium heat . add the garlic and onion and saute for 5 minutes . after 5 minutes, add the ground beef, and a pinch each of salt, black pepper, and oregano . saute for 5 minutes . add the tomato sauce . mix well and set aside . in small baking dishes, add a layer of potatoes . top with a layer of ground beef . top with grated cheese . place under an oven broiler until the cheese has melted.

name: thai chicken peanut lettuce tacos
description: not your ordinary tacos these thai chicken lettuce tacos are spicy and exotic, made with my light peanut sauce which i make with pb2 powdered peanut butter sriracha, ginger and spices . to balance out the spice, i chose to serve these in crisp cool lettuce wraps but tortillas would work great too
ner: reduced sodium chicken broth, pb2, sriracha chili sauce, honey, soy sauce, freshly grated ginger, garlic, cooking spray, ground chicken, sriracha chili sauce, garlic, fresh ginger, soy sauce, shredded carrots, scallions, shredded red cabbage, chopped peanuts, cilantro leaves, lime wedges, iceberg lettuces outer leaves
ingredients: 1/2 cup reduced sodium chicken broth, 3 tbsp pb2, 1/2 tablespoon sriracha chili sauce, 1 tbsp honey, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 tbsp freshly grated ginger, 1 clove garlic, cooking spray, 16 oz ground chicken, 1 tbsp sriracha chili sauce, 4 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp fresh ginger, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 3/4 cups shredded carrots, 2/3 cup scallions, 3/4 cup shredded red cabbage, 2 tbsp chopped peanuts, cilantro leaves, 4 lime wedges, 8 iceberg lettuces outer leaves
steps: make the peanut sauce in a small saucepan combine chicken broth, pb2, 1/2 tablespoon sriracha, honey, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1/2 tablespoon fresh ginger, and 1 clove crushed garlic and simmer over medium low heat stirring occasionally until sauce becomes smooth and thickens, about 6 to 8 minutes . meanwhile, heat a large non stick skillet or wok over high medium until hot . when hot, spray with oil and saute the chicken until cooked through and browned, breaking it up as it cooks add the sriracha, remaining garlic and ginger and saute 1 minute . add the tablespoon of soy sauce, cook 1 minute . add the shredded carrots, and 1/2 cup of the scallions and saute until tender crisp, about 1 2 minutes . set aside . divide the chicken equally between 8 lettuce leaves, top each with shredded cabbage, remaining scallions, drizzle with peanut sauce, chopped peanuts and cilantro, for garnish and serve with lime wedges.

name: how to make fresh basil pesto
description: traditional method for authentic mediterranean pesto with basil, garlic, pine nuts, and olive oil using a mortar and pestle or an immersion blender recipe can be made with cheese or without.
ner: fresh basil leaves, garlic, , pine nuts, freshly squeezed lemon juice, , extra virgin olive oil, , grated pecorino or parmesan cheese,
ingredients: 2 cups fresh basil leaves, 1 2 cloves garlic, , 2 tbsp pine nuts, 1 tbsp freshly squeezed lemon juice, , 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, , 4 5 tbsp grated pecorino or parmesan cheese,
steps: if you are using roasted garlic, roast your cloves prior to making your pesto . for instructions, click here how to roast garlic . if using raw garlic, be sure to cut out the green inner part of each clove with the tip of a sharp knife . also plan to give yourself some time to separate the basil leaves from the stems it takes a while to complete this preparatory step, but it's necessary . you really don't want stems or flower buds ending up in your pesto . in this post, you'll see the mortar and pestle that i own . it's a splurge, for sure . it was shipped from italy in record time . i cherish it and use it all the time . the maker offers many different sizes . i recommend using at least a 7 inch for pesto, and at least 8 inch is even better . for reference, mine is 9 inches . first, add your garlic and a very small pinch of salt to the mortar . use 1 clove for a typical pesto, or 2 cloves for a more pungent, garlicky pesto . use roasted cloves for a slightly sweet pesto, devoid of sharpness, that is easier to digest . use the pestle to pound and grind the garlic into a smooth paste, coating the interior of the mortar with smears of garlic . next, begin adding your basil . i always add basil early on in the pesto process, because it is the hardest ingredient to pulverize, and you will need the scraping traction of the interior of the mortar walls to help break it down . start with about a third of your pesto leaves, and another very small pinch of salt . grind the leaves against the walls of the mortar, using a rotational movement of the mortar and pestle to pulverize them as best you can . it will take some time and patience . have a small silicone spatula handy to scrape the pestle, as well as the edges of the mortar, from time to time . juice will begin to collect in the bottom of the mortar as the cells of the basil get broken down . continue adding more leaves, repeating the process until all of the basil has been broken down . you're looking for your basil to be mostly pulverized, without pieces of leaves or stems in the mix . if it doesn't seem to be breaking down fast enough, add a little more salt but careful, if you're adding cheese later the pesto can turn overly salty very quickly . at this point, add your pine nuts . you can add them straight to the mortar and grind them into the basil, which is what i usually do . some cooks like to hand chop the pine nuts, then stir them in for a more rustic texture . as you continue to grind, the pine nuts will give a slightly creamy texture to the pesto . by now, your pesto will be quite thick.when your pine nuts are fully incorporated and broken down to very small bits, you're ready to add fresh lemon juice . stir in about a tablespoon of juice . this will brighten the flavor of your pesto . the lemon also helps to keep it fresh and bright green . now it's time to stir in your olive oil . use your spatula for this step . i usually use about 1/4 cup or so for a batch of this size . you'll want to add olive oil until the pesto is glossy with a lovely sheen . the oil should almost pool on the surface of the pesto . scrape the sides of the mortar with a spatula and stir well . at this point, you have a basic, authentic pesto about 1/2 cup or so or around 3/4 cup if you've added cheese . if your pesto is cheese free, add salt to taste at this point the salt really enhances the flavor and helps to balance everything.some people like a thicker pesto, while others prefer a more liquid pesto for drizzling . if you'd like a more liquid texture, add more olive oil by the tablespoon until you have the desired texture . your pesto is now ready to serve.

name: bucatini with bottarga
description: bucatini with bottarga with bucatini, garlic cloves, evoo, garlic cloves, parsley, mullet bottarga, chili flakes, large eggs, water, oil, semolina flour, salt
ner: bucatini, garlic cloves, evoo, garlic cloves, parsley, mullet bottarga, chili flakes, large eggs, water, oil, semolina flour, salt
ingredients: 1.0 pound bucatini, 8.0 garlic cloves, 4.0 ounce evoo, 8.0 garlic cloves, 2.0 ounce parsley, mullet bottarga, chili flakes, 4.0 large eggs, 2.0 tablespoon water, 1.0 tablespoon oil, 3.3 cup semolina flour, 0.5 teaspoon salt
steps: cook pasta in salted water . combine cooked pasta in a large bowl with 2 oz pasta water, evoo, garlic, chili flakes and parsley . add pasta and peas to pan of pancetta and garlic, with 4 oz of pasta water, cook for one minute . finish with grated bottarga . place eggs, water, flour and salt in mixer bowl . attache bowl and flat beater . turn to speed 2 and mix 30 seconds . exchange flat beater for dough hook . turn to speed 2 and knead 2 minutes . remove dough from bowl and hand knead for 1 to 2 minutes . let rest for 20 minutes . divide dough into 4 pieces before processing with pasta attachment.

name: mississippi mud with a twist
description: this is a recipe my husband loves . it have all the stuff in it he likes . will make a 13x9 pan . rich and goes a long ways.
ner: fudge, butter, water, eggs, pecan, chocolate chip, caramels, evaporated milk, pecan, butter, unsweetened cocoa, vanilla extract, powdered sugar
ingredients: 1.0 box fudge, 0.5 cup butter, 0.2 cup water, 3.0 eggs, 6.0 ounce pecan, 11.5 ounce chocolate chip, 11.0 ounce caramels, 5.0 ounce evaporated milk, 6.0 ounce pecan, 1.0 stick butter, 0.3 cup unsweetened cocoa, 1.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 16.0 ounce powdered sugar
steps: make brownie mix with butter, water and eggs . i melt the butter in the microwave because it is replacing oil . add 6 oz or 1.5 cups pecan pieces into batter and mix in add all the chocolate chips into batter and mix in spread batter into greased 13x9 pan . bake at 350of for 25min caramel mix unwrap all the candy into a microwaveable bowl and add the milk you do not use in the frosting . spread the caramel mix on top of the baked brownie sprinkle 6 oz of pecans on top of caramel mix frosting mix butter, 1/3 cup milk, cocoa power, vanilla, powdered sugar . spread over pecans . serve worm or cold and enjoy.

name: steak au jus
description: steak au jus with sirloin steak, lipton recipe secrets beefy onion soup mix, olive oil, water
ner: sirloin steak, lipton recipe secrets beefy onion soup mix, olive oil, water
ingredients: 2.0 pound sirloin steak, 1.0 lipton recipe secrets beefy onion soup mix, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 cup water
steps: arrange steak in broiler pan without the rack . brush both sides of steak with lipton recipe secrets beefy onion soup mix combined with olive oil . broil steak until desired doneness, turning once . remove steak to serving platter . add hot water to pan and stir, scraping brown bits from bottom of pan . serve sauce over steak.

name: beef stew with dried porcini mushrooms and white win
description: a beef stew parfumed with dried porcini mushrooms and white wine
ner: beef stew meat, white wine, thyme, onion, flour, dried porcini mushrooms, butter
ingredients: 1.0 kilogram beef stew meat, 125.0 milliliter white wine, thyme, 1.0 onion, 1.0 tablespoon flour, 30.0 gram dried porcini mushrooms, 20.0 gram butter
steps: peel the onion and chop it roughly . melt the butter in a casserole and add the onion . leave it to cook on a moderate heat until soft but not coloured . add the beef to the onion, thyme, leave it to colour lightly, during 5 minutes . sprinkle with the flour and stir to combine, add the white wine and increase the heat during 3/4 minutes . tip into the casserole with the water the water must recover slightly the pieces of meat . check the seasoning bring to the boil and simmer for 5 minutes then stir into the casserole covert to a moderate heat, stirring occasionally . in a bowl, soak the dried porcini mushrooms in hot water for about 30 minutes . drain and add in the casserole 20 minutes before the end of the cooking time . you could serve this stew with rice, pasta, polenta or millet seeds .

name: no cook cookies and cream ice cream
description: no fussy custard base here just blend the base, fold in cookies, and churn your way toward amazing homemade ice cream . classic sandwich cookies such as oreos add chocolaty appeal, but you can use any crisp cookie, including chocolate chip or gingersnaps . the recipe is a yummly original created by martha holmberg https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/martha holmberg .
ner: chocolate sandwich cookies, half and half, granulated sugar, sour cream, heavy cream, vanilla extract, salt
ingredients: 14.0 chocolate sandwich cookies, 1.0 cup half and half, 1.0 cup granulated sugar, 1.0 cup sour cream, 2.0 cup heavy cream, 1.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 0.1 teaspoon salt
steps: break the cookies into 5 or 6 pieces each . put one third of cookie pieces in a blender and pulse to crush into finer crumbles . transfer to a small bowl, and set crumbles and pieces aside . combine the half and half and sugar in the blender and blend at low speed until sugar is dissolved, about 1 minute . add the sour cream and blend for 30 seconds . add the heavy cream, vanilla, and salt and blend for an additional 30 seconds . pour the cream mixture into the freezer unit of an ice cream maker and start to churn according to manufacturer's directions . once the ice cream is thick enough to hold a shape, add the cookie pieces and crumbles . continue to churn until thick, and mixture is starting to freeze hard around edges of the freezer bowl . quickly scoop out the ice cream and transfer to a metal bowl or other freezer safe container . cover well with plastic wrap and freeze until firm, at least 5 hours . serve in bowls, on cones, or with a slice of angel food cake.

name: classic garlic baked chicken thighs
description: here's a great dish to have in your repertoire for those times when you need to get dinner together in a hurry . the prep takes all of 5 minutes and the chicken is done in about 20 more the recipe is a yummly original created by edwina clark https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/edwina clark .
ner: nonstick cooking spray, chicken thighs, salt, black pepper, olive oil, garlic powder
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 4.0 chicken thighs, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon black pepper, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder
steps: preheat the oven to 425degf . line a sheet pan with aluminum foil . spray liberally with nonstick cooking spray . whisk together the salt, black pepper, olive oil, and garlic powder in a medium mixing bowl . add the chicken to the mixing bowl, and toss to coat in the olive oil and flavorings . arrange the chicken thighs on the prepared sheet pan . bake on middle rack of oven until the thickest part of the chicken reaches and internal temperature of 165degf, about 20 minutes . check to see that chicken is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow the chicken thighs to rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: roasted halibut with beurre blanc
description: delicate roasted halibut with a rich wine butter sauce sounds and looks impressive, but is quite easy to make.
ner: halibut fillet, olive oil, salt, black pepper, olive oil, shallot, fresh thyme, white wine, heavy cream, salted butter, salt, black pepper, lemon
ingredients: 1.0 pound halibut fillet, 1.0 teaspoon olive oil, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 1.5 teaspoon olive oil, 1.0 shallot, 1.0 sprig fresh thyme, 0.3 cup white wine, 0.2 cup heavy cream, 0.8 cup salted butter, salt, black pepper, 1.0 lemon
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a large baking sheet with parchment paper . lay the halibut skin side down on the baking sheet . rub the top of the fillet with the olive oil and season with salt and black pepper . roast the halibut on middle rack of oven until it is just opaque and flakes easily with a fork, 10 14 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fillet . while the halibut roasts, prepare the beurre blanc . heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat . add the minced shallot and saute until translucent, 3 4 minutes . place the thyme sprig in the skillet . pour the wine into the skillet and allow to simmer until liquid is reduced by half . slowly whisk in the heavy cream . reduce heat to medium low . whisking constantly, add the butter to the skillet three pats at a time, whisking until the butter is fully melted into the sauce between each addition . remove skillet from the heat . check to see that halibut is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . transfer halibut to a serving plate . squeeze lemon juice over the fillet . discard the thyme sprig from the beurre blanc and drizzle the sauce over the fish . serve immediately.

name: mediterranean olive chicken
description: healthy marinated roast chicken recipe with mediterranean marinade green olives, lime, honey, garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes.
ner: chopped ripe green olives, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lime juice, crushed garlic, honey, lime zest, red pepper flakes, dried oregano, salt and pepper, chicken pieces, , dry white wine, cornstarch
ingredients: 3/4 cup chopped ripe green olives, 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil, 2 tbsp fresh lime juice, 1 tbsp crushed garlic, 2 tsp honey, 1/2 tsp lime zest, 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes, 1/2 tsp dried oregano, salt and pepper, 4 5 lbs chicken pieces, , 1/4 cup dry white wine, 2 tsp cornstarch
steps: in a mixing bowl, whisk together the chopped olives, olive oil, lime juice, garlic, honey, lime zest, red pepper flakes and oregano . season the marinade with salt and pepper to taste . sprinkle the chicken pieces lightly with salt and pepper . place chicken pieces in a 9x13 ceramic or glass baking dish . brush the pieces evenly with olive marinade, using all of the marinade to coat . cover the baking dish with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, up to overnight overnight is best . preheat oven to 375 degrees f . remove the plastic wrap and cover the baking dish with parchment or foil . if using foil, pierce a few vents with a sharp knife around the outer edges . if using parchment, simply cover the dish loosely . place the covered dish in the oven . let the chicken bake for 60 minutes, then remove the parchment or foil and cook for an additional 15 30 minutes, basting periodically, until well cooked and tender . at the end of cooking, you may broil it for a minute or two to brown the skin watch carefully to make sure it doesn't burn transfer chicken pieces to a platter . carefully tip the baking dish so that the pan drippings and juices gather in one corner . use a spoon to skim off the clear liquid fat, separating it from the solid drippings . discard the fat . pour the remaining drippings into a small saucepan along with 1/4 cup of white wine . heat the sauce slowly over medium.while sauce is heating, whisk together 1 tbsp cornstarch or 2 tsp potato starch and 2 tbsp water till smooth . pour the starchy liquid into the saucepan and whisk until combined . heat the sauce until bubbling and thickened . serve the chicken topped with warm sauce . note this recipe is kosher for passover if you use potato starch and passover approved products with a kosher hechsher.

name: ham and cheese muffins
description: ham and cheese muffins with flour, baking powder, salt, egg, buttermilk, vegetable oil, ham steak, cheddar cheese
ner: flour, baking powder, salt, egg, buttermilk, vegetable oil, ham steak, cheddar cheese
ingredients: 2.0 cup flour, 1.0 tablespoon baking powder, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 1.0 egg, 1.0 cup buttermilk, 0.2 cup vegetable oil, 8.0 ounce ham steak, 1.5 cup cheddar cheese
steps: heat oven to 400 degrees f . lightly grease and flour 12 regular muffin tins . in a large bowl stir together the flour, baking powder and salt set aside . whisk together the egg, buttermilk and oil in a small bowl . stir in the ham and cheese . using a rubber spatula, stir the egg mixture into the dry ingredients just until combined . do not overmix . spoon into each of the prepared muffin tins approximately 3/4 full . bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes . remove from muffin tin and let cool.

name: fat free baked apples with no sugar added
description: like eating apple pie, without the added fat and sugar
ner: nonstick cooking spray, granny smith apples, stevia, ground cinnamon, salt, lemon, no sugar added apple juice
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 4.0 granny smith apples, 2.0 packet stevia, 1.0 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1.0 dash salt, 0.5 lemon, 2.0 tablespoon no sugar added apple juice
steps: preheat the oven to 350degf . spray a 9 inch square baking dish with nonstick cooking spray . peel and core the apples . slice the apples into 1/4 inch thick slices, then arrange in an even layer in the baking dish . sprinkle the apple slices with the stevia, cinnamon, and salt . squeeze the juice from the lemon half over the apples, then pour the apple juice over the apples . cover the baking dish with a sheet of aluminum foil . bake the apples on middle rack of oven for 20 minutes . carefully remove the foil and stir the apples, spooning the juice over the top . return the apples to oven and continue baking until apples are fork tender, 15 20 minutes . check to see that apples are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow the baked apples to cool for 5 10 minutes before serving.

name: chicken okra stew
description: simple and tasty stew made with okra, chicken, carrots and north african spices . delicious one pot meal.
ner: extra virgin olive oil, large chicken thighs, bone in, skin on, medium onion, , medium carrots, , garlic, fresh okra, , low sodium chicken broth, , diced tomatoes, , tomato paste, paprika, cinnamon, cumin, turmeric, cayenne, chopped cilantro, , large saute pan
ingredients: 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 4 large chicken thighs, bone in, skin on, 1 medium onion, , 2 medium carrots, , 2 tsp garlic, 1 lb fresh okra, , 2 cups low sodium chicken broth, , 1 3/4 cups diced tomatoes, , 3 tbsp tomato paste, 3/4 tsp paprika, 3/4 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp turmeric, pinch cayenne, 1/3 cup chopped cilantro, , large saute pan
steps: sprinkle chicken thighs lightly with salt and pepper . heat olive oil in a large saute pan with high walls over medium heat until hot . place the chicken thighs into the hot oil, skin side down, and turn heat to medium high . brown the thighs for about 10 minutes, flipping once halfway through, until thighs are browned on both sides and skin is golden and crisp . remove the thighs from the pan . do not drain the fat or juices from the pan . add the sliced onion to the pan and saute for 3 4 minutes until softened . add the carrots and saute them for 2 3 more minutes until the onion starts to turn golden . add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant . add 1/2 cup chicken broth to the pan, stirring and scraping up the brown bits from the bottom of the pan as the mixture cooks . add 1 1/2 cups more broth to the pan along with the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, cinnamon, cumin, turmeric, cayenne, and 3 tbsp of the chopped cilantro or parsley . careful with the cayenne when adding to taste, it's extremely spicy . i usually add 1/4 tsp of cayenne, which gives the stew a slight kick . stir the mixture and bring to a boil . add 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp black pepper to the pot . stir all the ingredients, then reduce heat to a simmer . put chicken thighs back in the saute pan and ladle sauce and carrots over them . cover the pot, vented on one side, and let the stew simmer for 45 minutes, occasionally basting the thighs with sauce, until chicken is tender . uncover the pot and remove chicken thighs and skin . stir the sliced okra into the sauce, bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low and cover again, letting the okra cook for 15 20 more minutes until tender . meanwhile, cut chicken meat from the bones in thick shreds, discarding bones, skin and excess fat . stir the sliced chicken back into the pot with the okra as it cooks . if the stew seems too dry, add a little chicken broth to rehydrate . let the mixture simmer until the okra is softened and the sauce has thickened . remove from heat and sprinkle with remaining 2 tbsp chopped cilantro . serve stew over cooked quinoa or brown rice . option if you prefer you can keep the chicken pieces whole rather than shredding them be sure to discard the skin before serving.

name: chicken enchilada manicotti
description: chicken enchilada manicotti with vegetable oil, , cooked chicken, shredded monterey jack cheese, chopped onion, , chili powder, manicotti pasta
ner: vegetable oil, none, cooked chicken, shredded monterey jack cheese, chopped onion, none, chili powder, manicotti pasta
ingredients: 2.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1.0 cup none, 2.0 cup cooked chicken, 2.0 cup shredded monterey jack cheese, 0.5 cup chopped onion, 1.0 jar none, 1.0 tablespoon chili powder, 8.0 manicotti pasta
steps: preheat oven to 375deg . spray 11 x 7 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray set aside . heat 1 tablespoon oil in 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat and heat chicken with 1/2 cup simple sofrito, stirring frequently, 3 minutes . turn into medium bowl, then stir in 1 cup cheese and onion . heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet and cook chili powder 1 minute . add remaining 1/2 cup sofrito and cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes . stir in pasta sauce and cook, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes or until slightly thickened . spread 1 cup sauce in prepared dish . evenly fill manicotti with chicken mixture arrange in dish . top with remaining sauce, then remaining 1 cup cheese . bake 30 minutes or until bubbling.

name: grilled indian pork kabobs with sweet onions and red bell peppers
description: these delicious, colorful kabobs are terrific served with rice pilaf or flavorful couscous and a medley of grilled vegetables . the indian spice rub can be made several days in advance . place in a covered jar and refrigerate until ready to use.
ner: pork sirloin roast, red bell pepper, sweet onion, nonstick spray, garlic, curry powder, kosher salt, ground cumin, ground coriander, cayenne, fresh lemon juice, olive oil, water
ingredients: 4.0 pound pork sirloin roast, 2.0 red bell pepper, 2.0 sweet onion, nonstick spray, 4.0 clove garlic, 2.0 tablespoon curry powder, 1.0 tablespoon kosher salt, 1.0 tablespoon ground cumin, 1.0 tablespoon ground coriander, 0.2 teaspoon cayenne, 0.5 cup fresh lemon juice, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 2.0 tablespoon water
steps: to make indian spice paste, place garlic in food processor and process until minced . add spices curry powder, kosher salt, cumin, coriander, cayenne, lemon juice, oil, and water . process until thoroughly combined . place pork in large self sealing plastic bag . pour paste over pork and mix pork with paste until pork is evenly coated . seal bag and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours . prepare medium hot fire in charcoal grill or preheat gas grill to medium high . thread pork onto skewers, alternating with pieces of red pepper and onion . spray grill grate with vegetable oil spray . grill kabobs directly over medium hot fire, turning to brown evenly on all sides, for total of 10 to 12 minutes . transfer to warm platter or individual dinner plates and serve.

name: cinnamon honey butter
description: how to make simple, delicious cinnamon honey butter to spread on toast, challah, or bagels for a sweet, creamy treat kosher, dairy or pareve.
ner: unsalted butter or margarine, softened to room temperature, honey, confectioner's powdered sugar, cinnamon, salt
ingredients: 2 cups unsalted butter or margarine, softened to room temperature, 1/2 cup honey, 1/4 cup confectioner's powdered sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, pinch salt
steps: combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl . use an electric mixer to whip the ingredients together until fluffy and well mixed . enjoy

name: air fryer chicken tenders
description: these crispy air fryer chicken tenders are golden and juicy, so easy to make and perfect for weeknight cooking
ner: chicken tenders, large eggs, kosher salt, black pepper, seasoned breadcrumbs, seasoned panko, olive oil spray, lemon wedges
ingredients: 12 chicken tenders, 2 large eggs, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, black pepper, 1/2 cup seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup seasoned panko, olive oil spray, lemon wedges
steps: season chicken with salt and pepper . place egg in a shallow bowl . in a second shallow bowl, combine the bread crumbs and panko . dip chicken in the egg, then into the breadcrumb mixture and shake off excess and place on a large dish or cutting board . spray both sides of the chicken generously with oil . spray both sides of the chicken generously with oil . preheat air fryer to 400f . in batches, cook the chicken 5 to 6 minutes on each side, until the chicken is cooked through and crispy and golden on the outside . serve with lemon wedges . serve with lemon wedges.

name: asian flank steak skewers
description: thin strips of grilled flank steak marinated with lime juice, ginger, garlic, sesame oil and soy sauce . these skewers disappear quickly at every gathering, so you may want to make a lot
ner: flank steak, reduced sodium soy sauce, minced garlic, fresh ginger, sesame oil, lime
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs flank steak, 1 1/2 cups reduced sodium soy sauce, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp fresh ginger, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1 lime
steps: soak wooden skewers in water about 30 minutes to prevent burning . marinate the steak in all the ingredients for about 1 hour or more . discard marinade and thread the sliced steak onto the skewers . heat your grill or grill pan to high heat when hot grill a few minutes on each side until browned and cooked though.

name: pork and pepper fajitas
description: have the family help make these quick fajitas . little ones can help sprinkle cheese, older children can help with rolling the tortillas up . make sure that an adult is present to help with the stove and sharp objects . serve with your favorite rice mix.
ner: boneless pork loin roast, green bell pepper, salsa, flour tortillas, cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro, parsley
ingredients: 1.0 pound boneless pork loin roast, 1.0 green bell pepper, 0.8 cup salsa, 4.0 flour tortillas, 1.0 cup cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro, parsley
steps: coat large nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray heat skillet over medium high heat . stir fry pork and green pepper in hot skillet for 3 to 4 minutes or until pork is lightly browned . stir in salsa heat through . wrap tortillas in paper towels . microwave on high power about 30 seconds or until warm . spoon pork mixture onto tortillas sprinkle with cheese . if desired, top wth cilantro or parsley . fold in ends roll up tortillas . serve with additional salsa.

name: stamppot van spruitjes, appel en rode ui met jus voor stamppot
description: een zalige hollandse stamppot maken ga maar vast aardappelen koken, spruitjes schoonmaken en stamppot jus maken voor een lekkere maaltijd.
ner: aardappelen, spruitjes, unox extra magere rookworst, appels, rode uien, vlees, mosterd, jus, boter
ingredients: 15.0 kilogram aardappelen, 750.0 gram spruitjes, 1.0 unox extra magere rookworst, 2.0 appels, 2.0 rode uien, 4.0 tablespoon vlees, 1.0 tablespoon mosterd, 1.0 bag jus, 50.0 gram boter
steps: schil de aardappelen en snijd ze in gelijke stukken . kook ze in ca . 20 min . in een laagje water met wat zout gaar . giet ze af en laat ze uitdampen . maak de spruitjes schoon en kook ze 5 8 min . in ruim kokend water met wat zout gaar . giet ze af . verwarm de unox rookworst volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . schil de appels, verwijder het klokhuis en snijd het vruchtvlees in stukjes . pel de rode uien en snijd ze in stukjes . verhit de blue band vloeibaar in een koekenpan . bak hierin de stukjes ui en appel 5 min . op een laag vuur . voeg wat zout en royaal peper toe . stamp de aardappelen met het appel uimengsel en de spruitjes fijn . voeg de mosterd en peper en zout naar smaak toe . maak de knorr jus voor stamppot klaar volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . snijd de worst in stukken . verdeel de stamppot over vier grote borden en leg de worst ernaast . schep de jus erover.

name: spiritual cod
description: if you have 65 minutes to spare and are in the mood for a baked seafood dish, then look no further . this meal is perfect for the summer and takes advantage of easily accessible ingredients that together will create a creamy and well seasoned mixture that will infuse itself into the delicate meat of the cod . once breaded and baked, the rich and crispy texture of the fish will pair well with a light salad.
ner: cod, butter, flour, cod, milk, cream, salt, ground black pepper, nutmeg, bread slices, milk, olive oil, onions, garlic cloves, carrots, olive oil, grated cheese
ingredients: cod, 60.0 gram butter, 60.0 gram flour, 275.0 milliliter cod, 275.0 milliliter milk, 200.0 milliliter cream, salt, ground black pepper, nutmeg, 2.0 bread slices, milk, 125.0 milliliter olive oil, 2.0 onions, 2.0 garlic cloves, 2.0 carrots, olive oil, grated cheese
steps: preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius . cook the cod in a pot of salted boiling water . when done, remove from pan, and remove skin and bones . shred the remaining fish meat . set aside 275 milliliters of the cooking water . in a pan, heat the butter . add the flour, and stir well slowly, add the cod cooking water, 275 millimeters of milk, and when mixture begins to thicken, add the cream . season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg . as soon as the mixture starts to bubble, turn off the heat . in a bowl, place the bread, add milk, and let it soak . heat the olive oil in a saucepan . add onion and garlic, and saute without burning . when half cooked, add the carrots, and simmer until carrots are done . add the cod, stir, and cook for few minutes . slightly squeeze the bread to remove excess milk, and crumble it into the pan . stir very well, and add half of the previously prepared sauce, stir, and correct the seasoning . as soon as it begins to bubble, turn off the heat . grease a baking tray with olive oil, and place the cod in the bottom . on top, spread the remaining sauce, and sprinkle with cheese . bake to gratin, for about 20 minutes . serve with a salad.

name: butternut squash and tomato soup
