description: salads are a perfect way to incorporate lots of fruits, vegetables, meats and cheeses into a light and refreshing meal . this asian salad is packed with all kids of delicious ingredients . this recipe calls for chopped iceberg lettuce combined with hearty vegetables . the delectable dressing combines sweet and savory ingredients for a powerful punch . dig in and savory the flavor and textures . we think you will love this recipe as much as we do.
ner: iceberg lettuce, cucumber, cilantro, carrot, toasted peanuts, scallions, olive oil, orange juice, white vinegar, ginger, soy sauce, salt and ground black pepper
ingredients: 0.8 head iceberg lettuce, 1.0 cucumber, 0.3 cup cilantro, 1.0 carrot, 2.0 tablespoon toasted peanuts, 2.0 scallions, 1.0 tablespoon olive oil, 2.0 tablespoon orange juice, 1.0 tablespoon white vinegar, 1.0 teaspoon ginger, 1.0 teaspoon soy sauce, salt and ground black pepper
steps: whisk together the olive oil, orange juice, vinegar, ginger, soy sauce, salt, and pepper . set aside . place the lettuce, cucumber, cilantro, carrot, and the white section of the scallions into a bowl and toss . add the dressing and mix to coat the salad evenly . place each half of the salad onto a serving dish and sprinkle with peanuts and the green section of the scallions.

name: pumpkin spice crepe cake
description: an indulgent cake made with layers of gluten free pumpkin spice crepes and pumpkin spiced coconut whipped topping
ner: flour, eggs, water, creamer, coconut oil, pumpkin puree, confectioner's sugar
ingredients: 1.5 cup flour, 2.0 eggs, 1.0 cup water, 0.8 cup creamer, 4.0 tablespoon coconut oil, 0.3 cup pumpkin puree, 0.5 cup confectioner's sugar
steps: the crepes are quite easy to pull together . just place the gf flour or all purpose if you don't have issues with gluten, eggs, water, international delight's pumpkin pie spice creamer, coconut oil melted or butter and 1/3 cup pumpkin puree in a container and whisk till well combined and there are no lumps . then just pour half a ladle of crepe batter into a pan on a medium flame and twist the pan around so the crepe batter spreads around, forming a crepe . mix the solid part of 1 can of coconut milk that has been refrigerated overnight, the pumpkin puree, confectioner's sugar, melted coconut oil, gelatin and 1 tablespoon of international delight's pumpkin pie spice creamer together with an electric mixer . the crepe cake is assembled by alternating crepes and about 2 tablespoons of frosting . i let the cake set in the fridge for about an hour . then topped it with some melted chocolate and it was ready to be savored.

name: rainbow israeli salad
description: make this colorful vegan side dish from israel . dressed with lemon and olive oil . so easy, pretty, and flavorful
ner: small red cabbage, shredded in small pieces, small ripe tomatoes, diced, yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced, persian cucumbers, diced small with skin on, small white button mushrooms, sliced, pitted kalamata olives, fresh lemon juice, olive oil, salt, or more to taste
ingredients: 1/2 small red cabbage, shredded in small pieces, 3 small ripe tomatoes, diced, 1 whole yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced, 1 lb persian cucumbers, diced small with skin on, 4 oz small white button mushrooms, sliced, 3/4 cup pitted kalamata olives, 3 tbsp fresh lemon juice, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/4 tsp salt, or more to taste
steps: combine all vegetables in a large mixing bowl and mix well . in a small mixing bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil and salt . pour over the chopped vegetables and mix well . serve.

name: hawaiian style tuna tartare spicy ahi poke
description: ahi poke is a local hawaiian dish that bears resemblance to the more commonly known tuna tartar . cubes of fresh tuna are tossed in a spicy mayo and garnished with green onion and can be served . to view more recipes like this, visit ataleofthyme.com.
ner: sushi grade tuna, mayonnaise, sriracha sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, green onion, canola, salt
ingredients: 0.5 pound sushi grade tuna, 3.0 tablespoon mayonnaise, 3.0 tablespoon sriracha sauce, 1.0 teaspoon soy sauce, 1.0 teaspoon sesame oil, green onion, 1.5 cup canola, salt
steps: in a bowl, mix the mayonnaise, sriracha, sesame oil, and soy sauce . remove the sinews of the tuna and cut the tuna into small cubes i prefer them very small although most grocery stores and restaurants in hawai'i cut them a bit bigger . add the tuna to the spicy mayonnaise sauce and mix well . chop the green onion and add it to the poke and mix well . then place the poke in the fridge for at least half an hour . in the meantime, heat up the oil in a pan . after the oil is hot enough for frying, add the won ton papers into the oil . after they are crispy and golden brown, flip the won ton papers to brown the other side . remove the won ton chips and drain them on a paper towel, then lightly dust the won ton chips with salt . serve the spicy ahi poke cold with the won ton chips for scooping the poke.

name: greek salad sandwich
description: if you love a greek salad, then you'll love this sandwich . crisp romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, kalamata olives, feta cheese and red onion on ciabatta bread with a touch of oil and red wine vinegar.
ner: red wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, kalamata olives, thin slices red onion, coarse salt and fresh ground pepper, crumbled feta, ciabatta bread, romaine lettuce leaves, medium cucumber, medium tomato
ingredients: 2 tbsp red wine vinegar, 4 tsp extra virgin olive oil, 5 tbsp kalamata olives, 4 thin slices red onion, coarse salt and fresh ground pepper, 4 tbsp crumbled feta, 12 oz ciabatta bread, 8 romaine lettuce leaves, 1/2 medium cucumber, 1 medium tomato
steps: in a small bowl whisk red wine vinegar, and olive oil, season with salt and pepper . add chopped olives and red onions set aside . i like to add the onions to the vinegar, this mellows out the sharpness of the onion, but completely optional . spread the olive mixture on 4 slices bread . top with lettuce, cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion season with salt and pepper . top with feta, close and cut sandwich in half.

name: skillet sweet potato chicken hash with eggs
description: skillet sweet potato chicken hash with eggs is grreat for breakfast, brunch or breakfast for dinner
ner: olive oil, medium onion, peeled sweet potatoes, fresh or 3/4 tsp dried thyme, garlic powder, paprika, leftover rotisserie chicken breast, large eggs, fresh chopped chives
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 medium onion, 10 ounces peeled sweet potatoes, 2 tsp fresh or 3/4 tsp dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon paprika, 8 oz leftover rotisserie chicken breast, 4 large eggs, 1 tbsp fresh chopped chives
steps: heat a 10 inch nonstick oven safe skillet over medium heat . add the oil and onions to the pan and cook until the onions are golden, 5 to 6 minutes . add the sweet potatoes and thyme, season with 3/4 teaspoon salt, garlic powder, paprika and pinch of black pepper and stir to combine . add 2 to 3 tbsp water, cover and cook the sweet potatoes over medium low heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp and tender, about 8 to 12 minutes . add the chopped chicken to the skillet and cook 2 minutes, uncovered . make 4 wide wells in the hash . crack 1 egg into each well and season with salt and pepper and cover . cook until the whites are set, but the yolks are still runny, about 5 to 7 minutes . top with fresh herbs.

name: sephardic charoset truffles
description: a moroccan recipe with dates, dried apricots, raisins, pistachios and honey . an exotic twist on charoset for your seder . kosher for passover, pareve, vegan
ner: pitted dates, dried apricots, golden raisins, shelled pistachios, honey, sugar, cinnamon
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups pitted dates, 1 1/2 cups dried apricots, 1/2 cup golden raisins, 3/4 cup shelled pistachios, 2 tbsp honey, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon
steps: place dates, apricots, raisins, pistachios and honey and place in a food processor . pulse for about 2 minutes until the mixture is smooth but still has texture . you may need to break up the sticky mixture a few times if it collects in a ball in the processor . in a bowl, mix together the sugar and the cinnamon . form date mixture into balls that are about 3/4 inch in diameter . the balls will be sticky and soft . it will be easier to shape them if you wet your hands slightly . dry your hands . dip the balls in the cinnamon sugar and coat thoroughly, and re roll between your palms to smooth out any rough edges . serve at room temperature.

name: hutspot recept met pittige rookworst
description: met dit originele unox recept voor hutspot zet je de lekkerste stamppot op tafel.
ner: ui, wortel, ui, runderbouillon, unox pittige rookworst
ingredients: 15.0 kilogram ui, 1.0 kilogram wortel, 500.0 gram ui, 2.0 block runderbouillon, 1.0 unox pittige rookworst
steps: schil de aardappels en snijd ze in stukken . pel de uien en snijd ze in ringen, schil de wortel en snijd deze in kleine stukjes . kook de aardappels, de wortel en de ui met de bouillonblokjes in ca . 25 min . gaar . maak intussen de rookworst klaar volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . giet de aardappels en groenten af en stamp ze fijn . breng de stamppot op smaak met peper en zout . snijd de unox pittige rookworst in plakjes . schep de hutspot op borden en leg de rookworst erbij . eet smakelijk

name: grilled and dilled corn on the cob
description: cooking light
ner: canola mayonnaise, light sour cream, fresh dill, fresh lime juice, kosher salt, ground black pepper, shucked corn, cooking spray, cotija cheese, chipotle chile powder
ingredients: 0.5 cup canola mayonnaise, 0.5 cup light sour cream, 0.2 cup fresh dill, 2.0 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 0.2 teaspoon kosher salt, 0.2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 10.0 ear shucked corn, cooking spray, 2.0 ounce cotija cheese, 1.5 teaspoon chipotle chile powder
steps: preheat grill to medium high heat . combine first 6 ingredients in a shallow dish . place corn on a grill rack coated with cooking spray cover . grill corn 12 minutes or until lightly charred, turning occasionally . place hot corn in mayonnaise mixture toss to coat . place corn on a platter sprinkle with cheese and chile powder.

name: classic pumpkin pie
description: classic pumpkin pie with pumpkin, firmly packed light brown sugar, salt, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, large eggs, milk, pie crust, fresh ginger
ner: pumpkin, firmly packed light brown sugar, salt, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, large eggs, milk, pie crust, fresh ginger
ingredients: 15.0 ounce pumpkin, 1.0 cup firmly packed light brown sugar, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 1.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 0.1 teaspoon ground allspice, 2.0 large eggs, 1.5 cup milk, pie crust, 0.5 teaspoon fresh ginger
steps: preheat oven to 425deg . combine sugar, salt and spices in small bowl set aside . beat eggs with pumpkin with electric mixer, then beat in sugar mixture . slowly add milk . pour into flaky pie crust . bake 15 minutes . decrease oven temperature to 350deg and bake 45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean . cool on wire rack 2 hours . chill, if desired.

name: cheesy baked pumpkin pasta
description: whole wheat pasta baked in the oven with a quick pumpkin sauce made with bacon, shallots, pecorino cheese and a touch of rosemary then topped with mozzarella cheese . this is such a great fall dish, and my husband loved how it turned out
ner: delallo uncooked whole wheat pasta, center cut bacon, shallot, homemade or canned pumpkin puree, reduced sodium chicken broth, grated pecorino romano cheese, salt and fresh pepper to taste, fresh rosemary, shredded pecorino romano cheese, shredded part skim mozzarella
ingredients: 8 oz delallo uncooked whole wheat pasta, 2 slices center cut bacon, 1 shallot, 15 oz homemade or canned pumpkin puree, 1 cup reduced sodium chicken broth, 3 tbsp grated pecorino romano cheese, salt and fresh pepper to taste, 1/2 tsp fresh rosemary, 1/4 cup shredded pecorino romano cheese, 1/2 cup shredded part skim mozzarella
steps: preheat oven to 375degf . spray a 9x9 inch baking pan with oil spray . bring a large pot of salted water to a boil . meanwhile, in a medium saucepan over medium heat add chopped bacon and saute until golden, about 3 to 4 minutes . add chopped shallot and cook 1 minute . add pumpkin, chicken broth, rosemary and 3 tbsp pecorino romano, stir and add salt and pepper to taste simmer about 8 10 minutes . meanwhile, cook pasta according to package instructions for al dente . drain and add the pasta to the pumpkin sauce and mix well . transfer to the baking dish and spread evenly . top with the remaining shredded pecorino romano and mozzarella . cover and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until mozzarella is melted and the edges are lightly browned . let it cool 5 minutes, then divide into 4 equal portions.

name: italiaanse kipkluifjes met macaroni en courgettebootjes
description: italiaanse kipkluifjes met romige macaroni en gebakken courgettebootjes van de bertolli pastasaus romig is geweldig lekker.
ner: kipkluifjes, kruiden, bertolli vloeibaar voor koken, bakken en roerbakken, courgettes, pasta, bertolli pastasaus romig, kers
ingredients: 400.0 gram kipkluifjes, 3.0 tablespoon kruiden, 3.0 tablespoon bertolli vloeibaar voor koken, bakken en roerbakken, 2.0 courgettes, 300.0 gram pasta, 1.0 bag bertolli pastasaus romig, 12.0 kers
steps: wrijf de kipkluifjes in met wat peper, zout en 2 1/2 eetlepels italiaanse kruiden . verhit 1 eetlepels bertolli vloeibaar in een koekenpan en bak hierin de kip in ca . 5 min . rondom bruin . laat de kip met het deksel op de pan in ca . 10 min . gaar worden . maak ondertussen de courgettes schoon, halveer ze en snijd ze in de lengte in zes repen . wrijf de courgettebootjes in met wat peper, zout en ca . 1/2 el italiaanse kruiden . kook de bertolli pasta macaroni volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . giet de macaroni af . verhit de rest van de bertolli vloeibaar in een hapjespan en bak hierin de courgettebootjes in ca . 5 min . lichtbruin en gaar . verwarm de bertolli pastasaus romig in dezelfde pan als waarin de pasta is gekookt . meng met de warme macaroni . verdeel de pasta en de kip over de warme borden, zet de courgettebootjes erbij en steek op de kop van elk courgettebootje een prikker met 'zeil' .

name: skinny loaded nachos with turkey, beans and cheese
description: none
ner: baked tortilla chips, 99 lean turkey breast, cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper, fat free spicy black bean dip, reduced fat mexican cheese like weight watchers, pico de gallo salsa, light sour cream, fresh cilantro
ingredients: 4 oz baked tortilla chips, 8 oz 99 lean turkey breast, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt and pepper, 1 cup fat free spicy black bean dip, 1 1/3 cup reduced fat mexican cheese like weight watchers, 2 cups pico de gallo salsa, 1/2 cup light sour cream, 2/3 cup fresh cilantro
steps: preheat oven to 425deg . place 1 oz about 14 chips on four oven proof dishes or one large baking sheet . heat a large nonstick saute pan over high heat . add turkey . season with cumin, garlic powder, salt and pepper and saute until cooked through, breaking up meat into small pieces with a wooden spoon . when cooked, add bean dip and mix well . spoon the turkey mixture over the chips and sprinkle the cheese on top . bake until cheese melts, about 6 minutes . remove the nachos from the oven, top with pico de gallo, sour cream, cilantro and jalepenos . serve immediately.

name: white russian cheesecake bars
description: white russian cheesecake bars with chocolate sandwich cookies, unsalted butter, cream cheese, granulated sugar, cornstarch, kosher salt, large eggs, large egg white, heavy cream, coffee liqueur, vanilla extract, heavy cream, powdered sugar, cocoa powder
ner: chocolate sandwich cookies, unsalted butter, cream cheese, granulated sugar, cornstarch, kosher salt, large eggs, large egg white, heavy cream, coffee liqueur, vanilla extract, heavy cream, powdered sugar, cocoa powder
ingredients: 24.0 chocolate sandwich cookies, 5.0 tablespoon unsalted butter, 24.0 ounce cream cheese, 1.0 cup granulated sugar, 3.0 tablespoon cornstarch, 0.1 teaspoon kosher salt, 4.0 large eggs, 1.0 large egg white, 0.2 cup heavy cream, 0.2 cup coffee liqueur, 1.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 0.5 cup heavy cream, 2.0 tablespoon powdered sugar, 1.0 teaspoon cocoa powder
steps: preheat the oven to 350deg f . mist a 9''x9'' square pan with nonstick spray and line it with parchment . place the chocolate sandwich cookies in the bowl of the kitchenaid 9 cup food processor and pulse to crush . add the melted butter and process until combined . transfer the mixture to the prepared pan, pressing the crumbs down in an even layer . set aside . place the cream cheese, sugar, cornstarch, and salt in the bowl of the food processor . pulse to combine . add the eggs, one at a time, processing on low speed . scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula after each addition . pour in the cream and coffee liqueur while processing on low speed . transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and place it in a larger baking dish . pour very hot water into the larger dish, until it comes up about 1'' around the square pan . bake for 20 minutes at 350deg f then lower the oven temperature to 250deg f . bake for another 60 65 minutes or until set around the edges, but still slightly jiggly toward the center . turn off the oven and prop the door ajar with a wooden spoon . allow the cheesecake to cool slowly in the oven for at least one hour . refrigerate for two hours or overnight before removing from the pan and cutting into bars . garnish with sweetened whipped cream and dust with cocoa powder, if desired.

name: passover chocolate chip cookies
description: these rich and decadent matzo chocolate chip cookies are so good, you won't miss the chametz kosher for passover.
ner: unsalted butter, brown sugar, honey, vanilla, kosher salt, eggs, matzo cake meal, matzo meal, chocolate chips
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, 1 1/2 cups brown sugar, 2 tbsp honey, 2 tsp vanilla, 1/4 tsp kosher salt, 2 large eggs, 1 1/2 cups matzo cake meal, 1/4 cup matzo meal, 2 cups chocolate chips
steps: preheat oven to 350 degrees f . cream the butter with brown sugar, honey, vanilla and salt . add eggs and mix well . mix in cake meal and matzo meal . stir in the chocolate chips . drop by tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart . press down slightly to flatten . bake at 350 degrees for 12 15 minutes until slightly golden . these are great when slightly warmed, dipped in a cold, frothy glass of milk . yum

name: awesome bacon and potato egg casserole
description: your favorite breakfast staples all baked together in a simple and delicious casserole . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ner: nonstick cooking spray, bacon, frozen hash brown potatoes, eggs, whole milk, salt, black pepper, shredded cheddar cheese
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 8.0 strip bacon, 1.0 bag frozen hash brown potatoes, 12.0 eggs, 0.5 cup whole milk, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 6.0 ounce shredded cheddar cheese
steps: preheat the oven to 350deg f . spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray . set aside . place two sheets of paper towels on a large plate . set aside . place a large skillet over medium high heat . add the bacon and fry until brown and crisp, flipping once, 6 8 minutes . transfer the bacon to the paper towel lined plate . do not discard the bacon fat . return the skillet to the heat and add the thawed hash brown potatoes . cook, stirring occasionally with a rubber spatula, until slightly golden brown, 4 5 minutes . remove from heat . in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper . using clean hands, crumble the bacon into small pieces and add to the egg mixture . add the potatoes and shredded cheese . fold with a rubber spatula to evenly distribute . pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish . bake the casserole on middle rack of oven until top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 40 45 minutes . check to see that casserole is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow casserole to cool for at least 10 minutes before serving . cut the casserole into squares, or simply spoon onto plates.

name: cherry sorbet
description: sorbet a cherry licious ice cold treat on a hot summer day.
ner: cherries, water, sugar, fresh lemon juice
ingredients: 2 lbs cherries, 1 cup water, 2/3 cup sugar, 1 tsp fresh lemon juice
steps: stem the cherries and remove the pits . in a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the cherries with the water, sugar, and lemon juice, and cook until the cherries are very soft and cooked through, about 10 15 minutes . remove from heat and let it cool to room temperature, then refrigerate to chill thoroughly . puree the cherries and their liquid and put the mixture through a fine sieve . once the cherry mixture is chilled, freeze according to your ice cream maker's instructions.

name: bloemkoolroomsoep met kerrie en koriander
description: heerlijke voorgerecht voor kerst, bloemkoolroomsoep met kerrie en koriander . deze romige bloemkoolsoep is extra lekker en vol van smaak door de knorr kippenbouillon.
ner: bloemkool, knorr kippenbouillon, vloeibare margarine, kookroom, kerriepoeder, koriander
ingredients: 1.0 bloemkool, 1.0 block knorr kippenbouillon, 4.0 tablespoon vloeibare margarine, 100.0 milliliter kookroom, 1.0 teaspoon kerriepoeder, 4.0 leaf koriander
steps: snijd de bloemkool in kleine roosjes en was ze . laat de vloeibare margarine smelten in pan . voeg de bloemkool eraan toe en strooi de kerriepoeder erover en roerbak ze 5 minuten . los het knorr kippenbouillonblokje op in 500 ml kokend water . giet de bouillon bij de bloemkool en breng aan de kook . zet het vuur laag en laat het 20 minuten zachtjes koken . haal de pan van het vuur en pureer met behulp van een staafmixer tot een dunne soep . zet de soep op een zacht vuurtje en doe er al roerend de room bij . neem de pan van het vuur zodra het begint te koken . giet de soep in kommen of in soepborden . doe er wat korianderblaadjes bij als versiering . serveer de bloemkoolroomsoep met kerrie en koriander direct.

name: summertime cake pop bouquet
description: summertime cake pop bouquet with pillsbury baking spray with flour, pillsbury moist supreme pink lemonade flavored premium cake mix, water, crisco pure vegetable oil, large eggs, pillsbury creamy supreme pink lemonade flavored frosting, white baking chips, crisco all vegetable shortening, decorator sprinkles
ner: pillsbury baking spray with flour, pillsbury moist supreme pink lemonade flavored premium cake mix, water, crisco pure vegetable oil, large eggs, pillsbury creamy supreme pink lemonade flavored frosting, white baking chips, crisco all vegetable shortening, decorator sprinkles
ingredients: pillsbury baking spray with flour, 1.0 package pillsbury moist supreme pink lemonade flavored premium cake mix, 1.0 cup water, 0.3 cup crisco pure vegetable oil, 3.0 large eggs, 0.8 cup pillsbury creamy supreme pink lemonade flavored frosting, 2.0 cup white baking chips, 2.0 tablespoon crisco all vegetable shortening, decorator sprinkles
steps: heat oven to 350degf . coat 13 x 9 inch baking pan with baking spray . prepare cake mix according to package directions using the water, oil and eggs . spread evenly in prepared pan . bake according to package directions . cool completely in pan on wire rack . crumble cooled cake into extra large bowl . beat with electric mixer on medium speed until fine crumbs, about 2 minutes . spoon frosting over cake crumbs . beat until evenly blended . line a 15 x 10 inch baking pan with wax paper . roll cake mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls . place on prepared baking pan . insert sticks . place white baking chips and shortening in microwave safe bowl . microwave on high for 30 seconds . stir . repeat until mixture is smooth . reheat as needed while coating the cake balls . dip cake balls in mixture to coat, allowing excess to drip off . immediately sprinkle with decorator sprinkles . repeat with remaining cake balls . let rest until coating is hardened . place white foam ball inside decorator bucket . tie decorator ribbon in bow around top of bucket . place paper crinkle on top of foam ball to cover . arrange 18 to 20 cake pops, as desired, by inserting into foam ball base.

name: pancake
description: a real pancake from germany
ner: eggs, flour, water, milk, vanilla sugar, sugar, sugar
ingredients: 10.0 eggs, 1.0 kilogramm flour, 250.0 milliliter water, 1.0 liter milk, 16.0 gramm vanilla sugar, 500.0 gramm sugar, 2.0 sugar
steps: combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir fast when there aren't any lumps take it into a pan with a little bit oil if one side is golden brown turn the pancake serve the pancakes with applesauce, powdered sugar, jam or fruits enjoy your meal

name: savory butternut squash casserole
description: this savory butternut squash casserole is creamy, rich, and sure to impress the thanksgiving table.
ner: nonstick cooking spray, butternut squash, salt, black pepper, heavy cream, garlic, fresh thyme leaves, nutmeg, fresh white breadcrumbs, grated parmesan cheese, salt, butter
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 1.0 butternut squash, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 1.0 cup heavy cream, 1.0 clove garlic, 3.0 sprig fresh thyme leaves, 1.0 dash nutmeg, 1.0 cup fresh white breadcrumbs, 0.2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 0.2 teaspoon salt, 0.2 cup butter
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray . peel the butternut squash . cut it in half lengthwise and remove the seeds . slice each half crosswise into scant 1/4 inch slices . arrange the butternut squash slices in the casserole dish so that they are slightly overlapping . sprinkle with salt and black pepper . pour the heavy cream evenly over the squash . sprinkle with minced garlic, fresh thyme leaves, and nutmeg . place the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and salt in a mixing bowl . pour the melted butter over the bread crumbs and mix with a large fork until all the crumbs are moistened . sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the squash . bake the casserole on middle rack of oven until the squash is tender and bubbling at the edges and the topping is crisp and golden brown, 30 35 minutes . check to see that casserole is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow the casserole to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: roasted vegetables 'n rice
description: roasted vegetables 'n rice with zucchini, red bell pepper, frozen whole kernel corn, vegetable oil, knorr vegetarian veget bouillon cube, regular or convert rice, water, ragu organic pasta sauc, chopped fresh cilantro, lime juice, garlic, black beans
ner: zucchini, red bell pepper, frozen whole kernel corn, vegetable oil, knorr vegetarian veget bouillon cube, regular or convert rice, water, ragu organic pasta sauc, chopped fresh cilantro, lime juice, garlic, black beans
ingredients: 2.0 zucchini, 1.0 red bell pepper, 10.0 package frozen whole kernel corn, 2.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 2.0 knorr vegetarian veget bouillon cube, 1.0 cup regular or convert rice, 2.0 cup water, 0.8 cup ragu organic pasta sauc, 2.0 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, 1.0 tablespoon lime juice, 2.0 clove garlic, 15.0 ounce black beans
steps: preheat oven to 425deg . line jelly roll pan with aluminum foil . toss zucchini, red pepper, corn, garlic, 1 tablespoon oil and 1 crumbled knorr vegetarian vegetable bouillon cube on pan . roast, stirring twice, 35 minutes or until vegetables are tender . meanwhile, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat in 2 1/2 quart saucepan and cook rice, stirring frequently, 2 minutes or until golden . stir in water, pasta sauce and remaining crumbled bouillon cube . bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to low and simmer covered, stirring occasionally, 20 minutes or until rice is tender . stir in black beans cook until heated through . combine rice, vegetables, cilantro and lime juice in large bowl . serve hot or at room temperature.

name: bow tie sausage soup
description: this delicious recipe and easy to prepare recipe is just as good the next day as leftovers . serve with breadsticks and a green salad.
ner: italian sausage, onion, garlic, chicken broth, farfalle pasta, tomato sauce, worcestershire sauce, dried basil, dried thyme
ingredients: 1.0 pound italian sausage, 1.0 onion, 1.0 clove garlic, 6.0 cup chicken broth, 3.0 cup farfalle pasta, 15.0 ounce tomato sauce, 1.0 tablespoon worcestershire sauce, 1.0 teaspoon dried basil, 1.0 teaspoon dried thyme
steps: combine sausage, onion and garlic in a heavy, large covered pot cook until sausage is brown, breaking up sausage with wooden spoon . drain off fat . stir in chicken broth, uncooked pasta, tomato sauce, worcestershire sauce, basil and thyme . bring to boiling reduce heat . simmer, uncovered, about 20 minutes or until pasta is tender, stirring occasionally.

name: baked potato soup
description: this slimmed down version of a loaded baked potato soup has everything you love about a baked potato sour cream, cheddar, bacon and chives, at a fraction of the calories
ner: medium russet potatoes, small head of cauliflower, fat free chicken broth, 1 reduced fat milk, salt and freshly cracked black pepper, light sour cream, reduced fat shredded sharp cheddar cheese, chopped chives, bacon
ingredients: 2 medium russet potatoes, 1 small head of cauliflower, 1 1/2 cups fat free chicken broth, 1 1/2 cups 1 reduced fat milk, salt and freshly cracked black pepper, 1/2 cup light sour cream, 10 tbsp reduced fat shredded sharp cheddar cheese, 6 tbsp chopped chives, 3 slices bacon
steps: pierce potatoes with a fork microwave on high for 5 minutes turn over and microwave another 3 5 minutes, until tender . or if you prefer to use your oven, bake at 400f for 1 hour or until tender . cool . peel potatoes . meanwhile, steam cauliflower with water in a large covered pot until tender . drain and return to pot . on medium heat, add chicken broth, milk, potatoes and bring to a boil . use an immersion blender to puree until smooth . add sour cream, half the chives, salt and pepper and cook on low another 5 10 minutes, stirring occasionally . remove from heat . ladle 1 cup soup into each bowl . top each serving with 2 tbsp cheese, remaining chives, and bacon.

name: slow cooker overnight breakfast casserole
description: slow cooker overnight breakfast casserole with johnsonville vermont maple breakfast sausage links, green onions, red bell pepper, green chilies, chopped fresh cilantro, hash browns, shredded cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt, pepper
ner: johnsonville vermont maple breakfast sausage links, green onions, red bell pepper, green chilies, chopped fresh cilantro, hash browns, shredded cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt, pepper
ingredients: 2.0 package johnsonville vermont maple breakfast sausage links, 1.0 cup green onions, 1.0 red bell pepper, 4.0 ounce green chilies, 0.2 cup chopped fresh cilantro, 30.0 ounce hash browns, 1.5 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 12.0 eggs, 1.0 cup milk, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.1 teaspoon pepper
steps: cook sausage according to package directions cut into small pieces and set aside . in a bowl, combine the green onions, bell pepper, chilies and cilantro set aside . spray a 5 or 6 qt . slow cooker with cooking spray . layer a third of the hash browns, sausage, green onion mixture and cheese . repeat layers twice . in a large bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, salt and pepper pour over casserole . cover and cook on low for 7 8 hours or until a thermometer inserted into the center reads 160degf.

name: grilled chicken nicoise salad
description: grilled chicken nicoise salad with skinless chicken breasts, kosher salt, sugar, water, fresh basil leaves, lemon, fresh lemon juice, garlic, anchovy paste, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, extra virgin olive oil, small red potatoes, green beans, kalamata olives, roma tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, butter lettuce
ner: skinless chicken breasts, kosher salt, sugar, water, fresh basil leaves, lemon, fresh lemon juice, garlic, anchovy paste, dijon mustard, sugar, salt, extra virgin olive oil, small red potatoes, green beans, kalamata olives, roma tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, butter lettuce
ingredients: 1.5 pound skinless chicken breasts, 2.0 tablespoon kosher salt, 1.0 tablespoon sugar, 4.0 cup water, 1.0 cup fresh basil leaves, 1.0 lemon, 3.0 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1.0 clove garlic, 2.0 teaspoon anchovy paste, 1.0 tablespoon dijon mustard, 1.0 teaspoon sugar, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 1.0 cup extra virgin olive oil, 1.0 pound small red potatoes, 0.8 pound green beans, 0.8 cup kalamata olives, 4.0 roma tomatoes, 4.0 hard boiled eggs, 1.0 head butter lettuce
steps: for the chicken, combine 4 cups cold water, 2 tablespoons kosher salt and 1 tablespoon sugar . stir until the mixture is clear and all salt and sugar have been dissolved, about 30 seconds . add the chicken and place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours . while the chicken is brining, make the dressing . combine basil leaves, lemon zest and juice, garlic, anchovy paste, dijon mustard, sugar, salt and pepper in the bowl of a blender or food processor . blend/process till the basil is finely chopped . slowly add the oil while continuing to blend/process . stop when all the oil has been incorporated and the dressing is smooth . transfer to a glass jar or container with a tight fitting lid . set aside . dressing can be made up to 24 hours in advance . shake well before serving . place the potatoes in a medium sized saucepan . cover with water and add 2 teaspoons kosher salt . bring to a boil, then reduce to a steady simmer and cook for 8 10 minutes or until potatoes are fork tender . drain well and transfer to a bowl . drizzle lightly with extra virgin olive oil and toss to coat . season lightly with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper . set aside . place the beans in a gallon sized plastic zippered bag . add 1 teaspoon of water and close bag, leaving a small opening for steam to escape . place bag in microwave and cook on high power for 3 minutes or until beans are crisp and tender . drain the beans and place in a bowl . drizzle lightly with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle lightly with kosher salt . toss to coat . preheat your kitchenaid stainless steel 8 burner gas grill to a medium high heat . at about the same time you start the gas grill, remove your chicken from refrigerator, drain and pat dry with paper towels . drizzle the chicken lightly with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle lightly with kosher salt and generously with black pepper . brush and oil the grill grate of your gas grill . arrange the chicken on the gas grill and grill for 3 4 minutes per side or until light golden brown and an instant thermometer registers 160 f . remove from the grill and drizzle with a bit more olive oil and tent with foil for 5 minutes . slice and serve warm or at room temperature . to serve, line individual plates or a large platter with lettuce leaves . arrange the chicken, potatoes, green beans, and remaining salad ingredients over the lettuce . serve with dressing on the side.

name: smoked paprika roasted chicken
description: a vibrant coating of smoky paprika is all it takes to turn basic roasted chicken into something special . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ner: roasting chicken, salt, black pepper, butter, smoked paprika, dried thyme leaves, parsley leaves, garlic powder
ingredients: 1.0 whole roasting chicken, 2.0 teaspoon salt, black pepper, 2.0 tablespoon butter, 2.0 tablespoon smoked paprika, 0.5 teaspoon dried thyme leaves, 0.5 teaspoon parsley leaves, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder
steps: preheat the oven to 425degf . line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and position a wire rack in the pan . remove the giblets from the cavity of the chicken and discard . liberally season the chicken inside and out with the salt and black pepper . with clean hands, rub the butter all over the surface of the chicken, and under the breast skin . sprinkle the smoked paprika, thyme, parsley, and garlic powder over the entire surface of the chicken . place the chicken on the wire rack breast side up . tie the legs together with kitchen twine and tuck the wing tips beneath the body of the chicken . roast the chicken on middle rack of oven until the thickest part of the breast reaches an internal temperature of 160degf, 60 80 minutes . check to see that chicken is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow chicken to rest for 10 minutes before serving . leftovers may be refrigerated for 3 4 days or frozen for up to 2 months.

name: ham and chicken salad panini
description: ham and chicken salad panini with cooked chicken, cooked ham, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, red onion, dijon mustard, whole grain bread, shredded cheddar cheese
ner: cooked chicken, cooked ham, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, red onion, dijon mustard, whole grain bread, shredded cheddar cheese
ingredients: 1.5 cup cooked chicken, 1.5 cup cooked ham, 6.0 tablespoon hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 2.0 tablespoon red onion, 4.0 teaspoon dijon mustard, 8.0 slice whole grain bread, 4.0 ounce shredded cheddar cheese
steps: evenly spread chicken mixture on 4 bread slices, then top with cheese . evenly spread remaining 4 bread slices with mustard, then place on sandwiches, mustard side down . coat outside of sandwiches with remaining mayonnaise . cook sandwiches in 12 inch nonstick skillet or grill pan over medium heat, turning once, 6 minutes or until sandwiches are golden brown and cheese is melted . combine chicken, ham, 1/4 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise and onion in large bowl.

name: tim love's grilled parmesan and shallot chicken
description: a chef tim love recipe
ner: hellmann's or best foods mayonnaise dressing with olive oil, shredded parmesan cheese, shallot, garlic, boneless chicken breasts, salt, cracked black pepper
ingredients: 0.2 cup hellmann's or best foods mayonnaise dressing with olive oil, 2.0 tablespoon shredded parmesan cheese, 0.2 shallot, 0.5 clove garlic, 4.0 boneless chicken breasts, salt, cracked black pepper
steps: preheat grill to high . mix hellmann's or best foods mayonnaise dressing with olive oil, parmesan cheese, shallot and garlic . place approximately 1 tablespoon under the skin of each breast . season breasts with salt and cracked pepper . place on grill skin side down and shut lid of grill . grill for about 5 minutes and then flip and grill for about 5 more minutes . remove from grill when internal temperature is 165deg . serve immediately.

name: ice cream of raspberry and strawberry
description: the secret to making "ice cream" in a flash is to freeze the fruits beforehand, so they act like ice cubes and help lend body to the puree besides lending flavor and also color . in this summery version, fresh strawberries and raspberries combine to make a vibrantly hued dessert that's got much less fat, and also a welcome tang thanks to the plain yogurt in the mix, while lemon adds pleasant tartness to balance out the sweetness.
ner: strawberries, raspberries, powdered sugar, sour cream, natural greek yogurt, lemon
ingredients: 250.0 strawberries, 250.0 raspberries, 80.0 powdered sugar, 125.0 milliliter sour cream, 250.0 natural greek yogurt, 0.2 lemon
steps: freeze the fruits in advance . combine all of the ingredients in a kitchen mixer and chop until you've obtained the desired consistency . serve immediately.

name: dong quai cornish hen soup
description: dong quai is known as female ginseng and has been recognized its various health benefits . when i had some issue about female hormone imbalance, my chinese qigong doctor taught me this special soup . i found sliced dong quai sold at my favorite natural grocery, so i prepared this again . you would love this simple yet yummy and powerful soup.
ner: none, none, none, none, none
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: put all ingredients except salt in a cast iron pot or crockpot and simmer for 4 hours . when you serve, you can add a pinch of salt to your taste..

name: deconstructed blt
description: deconstructed blt with pork belly, kosher salt, black pepper, cherry tomatoes, garlic, honey, vinegar, olive oil, wonder bread, heavy cream, lovage
ner: pork belly, kosher salt, black pepper, cherry tomatoes, garlic, honey, vinegar, olive oil, wonder bread, heavy cream, lovage
ingredients: 1.0 pork belly, kosher salt, black pepper, 1.0 pint cherry tomatoes, 2.0 clove garlic, honey, vinegar, olive oil, 2.0 loaf wonder bread, 3.0 cup heavy cream, 1.0 bunch lovage
steps: 1. score the skin of the pork belly in a diagonal pattern . 2. roast at 500degf convection oven for 45 minutes . chill in blast chiller and then slice a quarter inch thick . 3. for tomatoes, place tomatoes in very hot saute pan no oil . 4. add garlic to pan, continue to blister and cook down until the garlic is golden brown . remove from the pan and when the tomatoes are cool enough to touch, remove their skins . 5. return the peeled tomatoes and garlic to the pan . add honey and vinegar and cook down to jam consistency . taste and re season if needed . 6. for bread puree, place slices of bread into large mixing bowl . 7. add heavy cream and soak through . puree in blender and season to taste.

name: banh mi flatbreads
description: banh mi flatbreads with vinegar, salt, sugar, sliced cucumber, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, cilantro leaves, fresh mint leaves, sriracha sauce, toasted sesame oil, flatbreads, pork tenderloin
ner: vinegar, salt, sugar, sliced cucumber, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, cilantro leaves, fresh mint leaves, sriracha sauce, toasted sesame oil, flatbreads, pork tenderloin
ingredients: 3.0 tablespoon vinegar, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon sugar, 0.5 cup sliced cucumber, 0.5 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 0.5 cup cilantro leaves, 0.3 cup fresh mint leaves, 1.0 teaspoon sriracha sauce, 0.5 teaspoon toasted sesame oil, 2.0 flatbreads, 2.0 cup pork tenderloin
steps: 1 combine vinegar, salt and sugar in medium microwave safe bowl microwave 1 minute . add vegetables toss . let stand 30 minutes, tossing occasionally . 2 preheat oven to 350deg . combine hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, cilantro, mint, sriracha and sesame oil in bowl . set aside . 3 arrange flatbreads on baking sheet bake 10 minutes or until golden . remove to wire rack spread evenly with half of the mayonnaise mixture top evenly with grilled pork . bake 2 minutes until pork is heated through . 4 remove flatbreads from oven . drain vegetables, then evenly top pizzas . drizzle with remaining mayonnaise mixture and top with cilantro and mint leaves if desired . cut each flatbread in half.

name: white bean turkey chili
description: a delicious, creamy white bean turkey chili recipe made with canned white beans, ground turkey, aromatics and spices no tomatoes
ner: olive oil spray, small onions, garlic cloves, 93 lean ground turkey, 4.5 ounce can diced green chilies, kosher salt, cumin, oregano, chili powder, crushed red pepper flakes, bay leaf, 15.5 ounce cans of cannellini or navy beans, rinsed and drained, chicken broth, reduced fat sour cream or greek yogurt, monterey jack or pepper jack cheese, diced avocado, cilantro, sliced jalapeno, greek yogurt or sour cream, chopped scallions
ingredients: olive oil spray, 2 small onions, 5 garlic cloves, 3 pounds 93 lean ground turkey, 1 4.5 ounce can diced green chilies, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 tablespoon cumin, 1/2 tablespoon oregano, 2 teaspoons chili powder, 1/2 to 2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes, 1 bay leaf, 4 15.5 ounce cans of cannellini or navy beans, rinsed and drained, 2 cups chicken broth, 1/2 cup reduced fat sour cream or greek yogurt, monterey jack or pepper jack cheese, diced avocado, cilantro, sliced jalapeno, greek yogurt or sour cream, chopped scallions
steps: heat a large heavy pot or dutch oven over medium flame . when hot, spray with oil . add onions and garlic, saute until soft, about 4 to 5 minutes . add the meat and cook, breaking it up until white and cooked through, about 5 minutes . add diced green chilies, salt, cumin, oregano, chili powder, red pepper flakes and cook for 2 minutes . pure 1 can of beans in the blender with 1 cup of the broth . add to the pot with the remaining beans, broth and bay leaf and bring to a boil . cover and reduce to a simmer, about 30 to 35 minutes mixing occasionally, until thickened and the flavors meld . stir in sour cream and cook 4 to 5 minutes . adjust seasoning and salt to taste . to serve, topped with your favorite toppings . slow cooker directions to make in the slow cooker, follow steps 1 to 5, reducing the broth to 1 1/2 cups and transfer to the slow cooker for 8 hours on low . instant pot directions to make in the instant pot, you will need an 8 quart ip or halve the recipe . reduce the broth to 1 1/2 cups, cook high pressure 25 minutes.

name: migas com broa e feijao
description: https //www.facebook.com/receitastodososgostos/photos/a.1777204839173537.1073741878.1675729499321072/1789079554652732/ type 3andtheater
ner: none, none, none, none, none, none
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: numa panela com agua a ferver, tempere com sal e coloque a couve a cozer durante 7 minutos . depois da couve cozida escorra a . numa frigideira, leve ao lume o azeite e os alhos . mexa e deixe aquecer . junte a couve e salteie durante 1 minuto . junte a broa e salteie ate que fique tostadinha . por fim, adicione o feijao e salteie mais um pouco.

name: smoky lentil sweet potato soup
description: hearty, flavorful vegan soup with red lentils, sweet potato yam chunks, and spices . easy to make in 1 hour.
ner: extra virgin olive oil, large onion, salt, smoked paprika, ground cumin, ground coriander, vegetable stock, water, dry red lentils, sweet potatoes, lemon wedges optional garnish, parsley optional garnish
ingredients: 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 1 whole large onion, 1 tsp salt, 2 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp ground coriander, 1 quart vegetable stock, 3 cups water, 1 1/3 cups dry red lentils, 2 1/2 cups sweet potatoes, lemon wedges optional garnish, parsley optional garnish
steps: heat the olive oil in the bottom of a large sauce pot over medium heat . add the diced onions and salt and cook until onions are soft and translucent . add the spices and cook until fragrant . add the stock, water, lentils and diced sweet potatoes and bring to a boil . reduce to a simmer and cover, leaving a small portion of the pot vented . cook for 30 40 minutes, or until the lentils and sweet potatoes are tender . you can leave the soup chunky, or use an immersion blender for a smoother puree like texture . serve hot, garnished with lemon and parsley if desired . if you're not avoiding dairy, this soup is also fantastic served with a dollop of greek yogurt or labaneh.

name: papaya avocado salad
description: papaya, avocados, lime juice and cilantro this luscious tropical salad will make you feel like you are in the sunny caribbean.
ner: red onion, lime juice, medium hass avocados, papaya, chopped cilantro, salt and pepper to taste
ingredients: 2 tbsp red onion, 2 tbsp lime juice, 2 medium hass avocados, 2 cups papaya, 2 tbsp chopped cilantro, salt and pepper to taste
steps: in a small bowl combine onion, lime juice and salt . in a medium bowl, combine avocados, papaya, and cilantro . toss with lime juice and onions and serve immediately.

name: shrimp fried rice
description: 15 minute shrimp fried rice like chinese takeout but healthier and even better
ner: butter, shrimp, eggs, onion, medium carrots, frozen peas, garlic, rice, low sodium soy sauce, oyster sauce, black pepper, sesame oil
ingredients: 2.0 tablespoon butter, 1.0 pound shrimp, 2.0 eggs, 1.0 onion, 2.0 medium carrots, 0.5 cup frozen peas, 3.0 clove garlic, 3.0 cup rice, 4.0 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce, 2.0 teaspoon oyster sauce, black pepper, 0.5 teaspoon sesame oil
steps: heat 1/2 tbsp of butter over medium low heat in a large skillet or wok . add shrimp and cook . remove shrimp and set aside . add another 1/2 tbsp of butter to skillet . once melted, cook eggs until scrambled . remove and set aside . add an additional 1/2 tbsp butter and cook carrots and onions . saute for about 5 minutes or until the veggies soften . add peas, garlic, and pepper and cook another minute . increase the the heat to medium high and add the remaining butter . once butter is melted, add the rice, soy sauce and oyster sauce . stir until combined . continue stirring 3 4 more minutes to fry the rice . add in the shrimp and eggs . stir to combine . remove from heat and stir in the sesame oil serve warm.

name: triple berry smoothie
description: none
ner: blackberries and raspberries, medium strawberries, crushed ice, nonfat greek yogurt, few drops of liquid stevia for sweetness
ingredients: 1/2 cup blackberries and raspberries, 5 medium strawberries, 1 cup crushed ice, 6 oz nonfat greek yogurt, few drops of liquid stevia for sweetness
steps: put all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth . serve with a straw.

name: orange chocolate bites
description: i love this recipe . everyone who has tasted this recipe loves it . its easy, there's no added sugar, and it is vegan and paleo friendly
ner: min, nuts, orange, dark chocolate, coconut
ingredients: 10.0 min, 1.0 cup nuts, orange, dark chocolate, 2.0 cup coconut
steps: place soaked dates, coconut, nuts, and squeezed orange juice in food processor . process until everything is well combined . it should be sticky . pour mix into lined bread pan and put in freezer until it becomes firm . add coconut and orange zest to food processor and process for about 30 seconds and pour into a small bowl . once your slab is firm cut into bite sized 1 inch squares . dip in dark chocolate then into orange coconut . place on a cookie sheet and place in freezer until chocolate sets . store in freezer bags or in a lined container.

name: rainbow swiss chard
description: none
ner: rainbow swiss chard, garlic, red pepper flakes, olive oil, salt and fresh pepper to taste
ingredients: 1 pound rainbow swiss chard, 2 clove garlic, 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes, 2 tsp olive oil, salt and fresh pepper to taste
steps: heat the oil over medium heat in a saute pan . smash the garlic clove with the side of a knife and add it to the pan . add red pepper flakes if using, saute the garlic lightly in the oil until it becomes golden . chop the stems into small pieces and add to the oil . mix and add a drop of water and cover . cook about 4 5 minutes . chop the leaves and add to the pan . saute until just wilted, stirring frequently . season with salt and pepper.

name: santa fe meat loaf
description: santa fe meat loaf with ground pork, vegetable oil, onions, jalapeno chile, dried tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, thyme, cayenne, parsley, bread crumbs
ner: ground pork, vegetable oil, onions, jalapeno chile, dried tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, thyme, cayenne, parsley, bread crumbs
ingredients: 2.0 pound ground pork, 1.0 teaspoon vegetable oil, 2.0 onions, 1.0 jalapeno chile, 4.0 tablespoon dried tomatoes, 1.0 tablespoon chili powder, 1.0 teaspoon cumin, 1.5 teaspoon salt, 1.0 teaspoon thyme, 0.5 teaspoon cayenne, 0.5 cup parsley, 0.5 cup bread crumbs
steps: in large nonstick skillet heat oil over medium high heat . saute onions and garlic until soft, about 10 minutes cool slightly and transfer to large bowl . add all remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly . place mixture in a 9x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2 inch loaf pan and bake in a 350 degree f . oven for 1 1/2 hours, until a meat thermometer inserted reads 160 degrees f . remove from oven and allow to rest 10 minutes before removing from pan . slice to serve warm, or wrap well and refrigerate for sandwiches.

name: reverse marinade carne asada with black beans and greens
description: don't knock it 'till you try it, reverse marination is where it's at . this tastebud busting carne asada will have you jumping on the reverse marinade band wagon for sure . by marinating the steaks after they are grilled, the flavors are intensified and no marinade is lost in the making of this meal . the beans and greens are supercharged with nutrients and offer a perfect balance to the otherwise bold plate . the steaks boast a smokey and bright flavor that's uber concentrated, thanks to the reverse marination . so come join us on team reverse marinade, you won't be sorry
ner: flank steak, cumin, smoked paprika, black beans, green chili, garlic cloves, kale, jarred pickled chilies, chili oil, lime, salt, olive oil, tortillas
ingredients: 1.0 flank steak, 1.0 tablespoon cumin, 1.0 tablespoon smoked paprika, 1.0 can black beans, 1.0 green chili, 2.0 garlic cloves, 6.0 stalk kale, 2.0 jarred pickled chilies, 2.0 tablespoon chili oil, 1.0 lime, salt, olive oil, 4.0 tortillas
steps: preheat your oven to 425 degrees . get a grill pan warming over high heat and a large saute pan warming over medium heat . take notice of the direction of the grain of your steak before cooking . it's hard to determine once it's been cooked and we'll be cutting it against the grain later . season one side of the steaks with 1/2 tablespoon cumin, 1/2 tablespoon smoked paprika, a healthy sprinkling of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil . massage all that goodness into the steak . lay steaks, seasoned side down, in the grill pan . resist the temptation to touch the steaks in the pan, allow them to caramelize . now, season the top side of the steaks with 1/2 tablespoon cumin, 1/2 tablespoon smoked paprika, and another healthy sprinkling of salt . grab your chili and roll it on the counter to break up the seeds inside . cut off the top, shake out the seeds, and thinly slice into strips . next, thinly slice the cloves of garlic and set aside with the chilis we'll be using half for the beans and half for the marinade . strip your kale by holding it upside down and briskly stripping the leaves from top to bottom . give the kale leaves a rough chop . you know we're not wasting the stems, slice them as thin as possible . coat your hot saute pan with olive oil . take half of the fresh chilis and half of the garlic and add them to the pan . while those cook down a bit, grab your can of beans and drain the liquid from the can just use the lid . add the beans to the pan, along with the kale leaves and stems . toss everything to combine . it's been about 5 minutes and our steaks are getting smokey . flip the steaks and toss the entire pan into the oven . pour off the pickled chili oil into a bowl if you don't have chili oil you can use olive oil . on a cutting board, combine remaining fresh chili and garlic, pickled chilies, and the zest of one lime . finely chop the mixture into a paste, adding a large pinch of salt to help bust it up . add the mixture to the bowl with the chili oil . squeeze the juice of the lime into the bowl and stir to combine . add a healthy sprinkling of salt to the beans and greens . to marry the flavors of the meal, add a teaspoon of cumin to the pan as well . toss to combine and remove from heat . place a medium pan over medium heat . add tortillas to the pan in a single layer splash them with water to steam them just a bit . the steaks have been in the oven for about 7 minutes, it's time to take them out . remove the steaks from the pan and place into the bowl of marinade and smear them all around . add a pile of black beans and greens to your plate . slice the steak against the grain remember we identified the grain earlier, and add to your plate . finally, drizzle a bit of the marinade over the plated steak and line the side of the plate with warm tortillas . hot tip "against the grain" look over your steak before cooking it to determine the direction of the grain . it's tough to tell after the meat has been cooked . hot tip "oil what " your food, not the pan . this prevents from having too much oil in the pan as well as prevents burning . hot tip "rollin' chilis" roll your fresh chili on a hard surface to break up the seeds inside . then cut off the top and shake out the unwanted seeds . hot tip "strippin' kale" hold a stalk of kale upside down, quickly stripping from top to bottom, remove the leaves in one fell swoop . save the stems

name: tsukemon ramen
description: tsukemon ramen with all purpose flour, warm water, salt, kansui, sake, mirin, soy sauce, kombu, dried bonito flakes, sesame oil, pork belly, ginger, garlic cloves, thai hot chili pepper, shitake mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, green onions, chicken broth, miso paste, seasoned rice wine vinegar, pork, soft boiled eggs, fish cake, sliced bamboo
ner: all purpose flour, warm water, salt, kansui, sake, mirin, soy sauce, kombu, dried bonito flakes, sesame oil, pork belly, ginger, garlic cloves, thai hot chili pepper, shitake mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, green onions, chicken broth, miso paste, seasoned rice wine vinegar, pork, soft boiled eggs, fish cake, sliced bamboo
ingredients: 2.0 cup all purpose flour, 0.5 cup warm water, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 1.0 teaspoon kansui, 1.0 tablespoon sake, 0.2 cup mirin, 0.2 cup soy sauce, 2.0 inch kombu, 0.2 cup dried bonito flakes, 1.0 tablespoon sesame oil, 4.0 ounce pork belly, 1.0 inch ginger, 3.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 thai hot chili pepper, 4.0 ounce shitake mushrooms, 4.0 ounce enoki mushrooms, 2.0 green onions, 2.0 cup chicken broth, 2.0 teaspoon miso paste, 1.5 tablespoon seasoned rice wine vinegar, 6.0 ounce pork, 4.0 soft boiled eggs, 4.0 ounce fish cake, 4.0 ounce sliced bamboo
steps: first, combine the kansui and warm water in a small bowl . then add the kansui/water mixture to the flour in the bowl of your kitchenaid mini mixer . using the dough hook, set your mixer to speed 2 until the mixture has formed a ball, approximately 5 minutes . after 5 minutes, remove the dough from your mixer bowl and knead by hand for another 2 3 minutes . cut your dough into quarters, wrap in plastic wrap, and let rest for approximately 20 minutes . while your dough is resting, fit your mixer with the kitchenaid pasta roller attachment . after 20 minutes, remove the plastic wrap from your dough and flatten . turn on your mini mixer and begin to feed your flattened dough through the pasta roller attachment . fold each rolled sheet in half and re feed through the pasta roller, sprinkling with flour each time . continue this process until you have reached your desired noodle thickness we recommend the level 3 setting . once your sheets of noodle dough are to your liking, replace the pasta roller attachment with the kitchenaid spaghetti cutter attachment . feed the sheets of dough through the spaghetti cutter attachment, catching the noodles once they have been fed through . once all of your dough has been cut, dust the noodles with flour and set aside . in a small sauce pan, bring the sake to a boil over medium high heat . add the mirin, soy sauce, konbu, and bonito flakes . bring ingredients to a boil then reduce heat to a low slow simmer for 5 minutes . remove from heat and set aside . in a medium pot, heat the sesame oil over high heat, then add the pork belly, browning on both sides about 2 minutes on each side . remove pork belly from the pan and set aside later for toppings . in the same pan, add ginger, both types of mushrooms, and chopped white stem of the green onion, stirring until combined . add the chicken broth and soup base and bring to a boil . once boiling, add the miso paste and bring to a low simmer . continue to simmer for 10 minutes . stir in rice wine vinegar and remaining chopped green onion . place fresh noodles at the bottom of four bowls cover the noodles with the hot soup mixture . place a dinner plate over each bowl let sit for 5 minutes, adding more broth if necessary . after 5 minutes add desired toppings including the pork belly, soft boiled eggs, fish cake, additional green onion or sliced bamboo.

name: chicken couscous
description: healthy, easy and affordable savory moroccan inspired recipe for couscous with chicken, zucchini, carrots, celery, butternut squash and spices.
ner: extra virgin olive oil, chicken, onions, minced fresh garlic, low sodium chicken broth, salt, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, black pepper, butternut squash, peeled, cubed and seeded, zucchini, carrots, celery ribs, cooked chickpeas, instant couscous, fresh chopped cilantro or parsley
ingredients: 3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 1 whole chicken, 2 whole onions, 2 tsp minced fresh garlic, 3 1/2 cups low sodium chicken broth, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 1 lb butternut squash, peeled, cubed and seeded, 3/4 lb zucchini, 3/4 lb carrots, 2 celery ribs, 1 3/4 cups cooked chickpeas, 10 oz instant couscous, 1 tbsp fresh chopped cilantro or parsley
steps: heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large 8 quart pot over high heat until it just begins to smoke . place half of the chicken pieces skin side down and brown them for a few minutes . remove the chicken pieces and brown the other chicken pieces in the same way . remove the chicken from the pot and set aside . reduce heat to medium and add sliced onions to the pot . saute the onions, stirring frequently, until the onions soften and begin to caramelize . add the garlic and saute for a minute more until fragrant . add 1 1/2 cups low sodium chicken broth to the pot . stir in 1 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp cayenne and 1/4 tsp black pepper . scrape any brown bits from the bottom of the pan as you bring the stock to a boil . add the chicken pieces to the pot, using a pair of tongs to coat them with sauce before placing them skin side up . reduce heat to a low simmer and cover the pot, vented slightly . let them simmer on low heat for 45 minutes . remove chicken pieces from the pot and add the squash, zucchini, carrots and celery, stirring them into the broth to make sure each vegetable is evenly coated . bring to a boil . add the chicken pieces back to the pot on top of the vegetables . cover the pot tightly and reduce heat to a low simmer . let the vegetables cook for 15 minutes . gently stir the chickpeas into the chicken vegetable mixture . let the mixture cook covered for 5 10 more minutes until the largest vegetable chunks are tender . while the chicken mixture finishes cooking, prepare the couscous . in a small pot, bring 2 cups low sodium chicken broth to a boil . stir in 1/2 tsp salt, pinch of turmeric and 1 tbsp olive oil . stir in the couscous and cover the pot . remove the pot from heat and let the couscous steam for 5 minutes, until tender.fluff the cooked couscous with a fork or with clean hands, as my moroccan friend sharone suggests careful, it's hot and place it on a serving platter . use a slotted spoon to place the cooked chicken and vegetables on top of the couscous, then sprinkle with chopped cilantro or parsley . pour the cooking liquid into a large gravy boat . top each serving of couscous with a bit of cooking liquid to moisten . can be served with spicy sauce or harissa on the side.

name: pulled pork soft tacos
description: pulled pork soft tacos with cooked pulled pork, corn tortillas, iceberg lettuce, salsa
ner: cooked pulled pork, corn tortillas, iceberg lettuce, salsa
ingredients: 1.2 pound cooked pulled pork, 12.0 corn tortillas, 3.0 cup iceberg lettuce, 1.0 cup salsa
steps: heat a large skillet over medium heat . place two tortillas in the skillet and cook until warm and softened, about 30 seconds per side . fill the tortillas with about 1 1/2 ounces of the pork, 1/4 cup of the lettuce, and 4 teaspoons of the salsa . repeat with the remaining tortillas and serve . if you prefer to heat all of the tortillas at once, microwave them on high until warm and softened, 1 to 2 minutes.

name: turkey pot pie soup recipe
description: leftover turkey is delicious in turkey pot pie, so i thought why not use it to make turkey pot pie soup
ner: flour, turkey stock, fat free milk, large celery stalks, chopped onion, sliced cremini mushrooms, fresh ground pepper, chopped parsley, frozen peas and carrots, turkey better n boullion, medium, cooked turkey breast
ingredients: 1/4 cup flour, 2 cups turkey stock, 4 cups fat free milk, 2 large celery stalks, 1 1/2 cups chopped onion, 8 oz sliced cremini mushrooms, fresh ground pepper, 2 tbsp chopped parsley, 8 oz frozen peas and carrots, 1 tsp turkey better n boullion, 2 medium, 16 oz cooked turkey breast
steps: create a slurry by combining 1/2 cup of the cold broth with flour in a medium bowl and whisk until well blended . set aside . pour remaining broth and milk into a large pot and slowly bring to a boil . add celery, onion, mushrooms, parsley, fresh pepper, frozen vegetables, boullion and return to a boil . partially cover and simmer on low until vegetables are soft, about 20 minutes . remove lid, add potatoes and cook until soft, about 5 minutes . add turkey, and slowly whisk in slurry, stirring well as you add . cook another 2 3 minutes, until soup thickens, adjust salt and pepper to taste and serve.
